updates.update_content:
That's it. Our campaign is over.
First of all, I want to welcome the (significant number) of people who joined our campaign in the final days. Welcome, and thank you.
It's been quite a journey. I did a quick search of my inbox just now to confirm, and yes-- the first emails I have that reference this are from 2018. And I'm relatively sure I have notebook notes from 2017. Some ideas take a long time to come to fruition. Some never do at all. Thankfully, this isn't the latter situation... because all of you.

updates.update_userinfo: A goal, achieved-- plus, original Erica D'Urso IGR art available!
updates.update_content:
Hi again, everyone.
These updates have just become me praising and thank you every few days, haven't they?
Well, what can I say. That's your fault, not mine. You just keep coming through for us. Case in point: we have hit our mini-comic Stretch Goal. I'm so excited-- we get to share an extra story from this world with you, dig into a history that might have otherwise gone untouched, see more of Valeria Favoccia's take on this universe... I really think you're going to love it.

updates.update_userinfo: New reward tier, and old friends.
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
A quick update for you today-- we've had a few requests from retailers to add a Retailer Reward tier...  so we're doing it!

Hey, everyone,  a quick one from me today!

First of all-- we're really coming up on our next Stretch Goal! If I'm currency-converting correctly (and I quite possibly am not!), we're about $5,000 USD away from hitting it. I'm doing a bunch of podcasts and things this weekend to help spread the word, but we always appreciate your support -- so if you feel like letting a friend know about our campaign, or retweeting a tweet... it would be hugely appreciated, as ever, and also get us ever-closer to this very cool little extra:

Hello again everyone,
We crossed a huge milestone a few days ago-- now, whenever I send out these updates, they're going out to over 1,000 people. That's... really hard to comprehend, if I'm honest. More than one thousand people have come together to help make our little project a reality... and not make it so little. To turn out little spark into a blazing inferno.
Again, I'm not really sure how to express my gratitude, except to say that Team IGR will be working as hard as we possibly can to turn your passion and support into something compelling and meaningful.

Hi again, everyone!
We're powering towards that ashcan mini-comic Stretch Goal-- they say the middle of a campaign is slow, but the momentum you've all been bringing is astonishing. Thank you.
We're not slowing down on our end, either-- and we thought we'd give you an update on how we've been promoting INFERNO GIRL RED around the internet, in case you feel like sharing!

updates.update_userinfo: A lofty goal reached, a hidden history revealed...
updates.update_content:
We did it!!
Thanks to the incredible generosity and support of you all, we've hit our second stretch goal. That's right-- we'll be adding 20 pages of story to INFERNO GIRL RED, both digital and physical editions, free for all backers.
That's a 20% increase in story content, at no extra cost.

Every day, you surprise me.
I keep expecting things to really taper off, but instead, our campaign just continues to grow.
Then, yesterday, we released something that, honestly, we didn't know if anyone would be into. The fully-wearable replica helmets. I mean, we thought they were profoundly rad, but would anyone else share that enthusiasm?

campaign.story:
There'll be scary ghost stories
   And tales of the glories
   Of Christmases long, long ago
- Andy Williams, "It's the Most Wonderful Time of the Year" 


What is YULE? 
Yule. Geol. Weihnachten. Winter Solstice. 
Before the soda drinking bears, before the bright red suit, and before the litany of saccharine films & music that saturate every holiday season, there was cold and night and fear.  
Cover Image by Donna Black, Yule Logo by LetterSquids
This collection of short horror comics will examine Yule, Winter Solstice, Saturnalia, and a slew of other terrifying folklore from around the world, from well-known tales of Krampus to the lesser-known Mari Lwyd, and all the bizarre traditions in between. 
Art by Meredith McClaren
THE TEAMS
Contributing to this book is an all-star lineup of talent, with each team producing tight-and-terrorizing tales based on 14 different pieces of worldwide folklore:
MARI LWYD from Justin Jordan and Val Halhovorson 
KRAMPUS from Umar Ditta, Elliot Balson, Mike Maynard, and Rob Jones 
KARANKONCOLOS from Frankee White, Fell Hound, and DC Hopkins 
BELSNICKEL from Dillon Gilbertson and Matt Battaglia 
CAGA TIOS from Heather Vaughan and Jason Piperberg 
SMEE from Malissa White and Anastasia Longoria 
ELF ON THE SHELF from Kacey Flynn and J Schiek 
HANS TRAPP from Alex Schlitz and Grant Stoye 
MIDNIGHT SPEECH from Meredith McClaren 
TOES from Jack Foster 
GRYLA from Ian Mondrick and Kam White  
HUITZILOPOCHTILI from Jarred Lujan and Gregery Miller 
SATURNALIA from Joe Corallo and Elena Gogou 
PERCHTEN from Jenn St Onge 
Logo Design by LetterSquids 
Cover Art by Donna Black 
Lettering and Book Design by Toben Racicot 
Foreword by Heather Antos 
We'll also have incredible pin-up pieces from Minerva Fox, Marie Wolf, and Marie Enger.

BUDGETING
The $15,000 goal is the largest I've ever pursued, but it is to meet the compensation that each creator involved deserves: $9,000 will be going directly to the teams that made this book, with around $4,500 going to printing and shipping. The remaining costs are split between merch, design, and recouping some of the expenses I've paid out of pocket for this book.  
Art by Heather Vaughan & Jason Piperberg
Art by Alex Schlitz
Art by Gregery Miller
Art by Elena Gogou

Art by Fell Hound
What Others are Saying
NEW ADD ONs
Due to popular demand, we have created an add-on feature where you can order additional copies of YULE for friends, family, and frenemies. Also included in the add-ons is a new print from Alaire Racicot (Crown & Anchor, Sidequest):
This Krampus is only for the brave of heart
And a new print from our cover artist, Donna Black, featuring the one and only Mari Lwyd!
Do not let it in.
And for one of our higher tiers, this stunning original watercolor piece from Jack Foster's story, Bells Ring:
Art by Jack Foster, Amidala for scale
This piece measures 17x22, and it will be difficult not to worship. 

STRETCH GOALS
Every stretch goal we shoot for with YULE involves putting money into the pockets of the creators, additional shipping and printing costs excluded. 
$18,100 sees each creator involved pocket an extra hundred bucks. 
$21,500 gives each creator two hundred dollars. 
$31,000 has every creator take home an extra $500
Any additional funds go to printing, shipping, and blood sacrifices to make YULE vol 2.  
Artwork by Matt Battaglia
Artwork by J Schiek

updates.update_content:
It's been a while between updates, and for that I apologize - life sometimes gets in the way. BUT BUT BUT, we have some pretty damn cool news to share!

First off, the art rewards are wrapping up, and they are spectacular. We REALLY think you're going to dig 'em, and hopefully you can put them above your mantle during the holidays and bask in the glow of solstices past.

Wow, it's been just over a week and it still doesn't feel real - the flood of support y'all showed has humbled every single one of us involved in this book. Thank you so, so much. 

Today I'll be working on contacting the various tier winners in regards to their rewards, so keep an eye on your mailboxes! I'll also be sending out the reward surveys, so please try to reply to those as soon as you can.

Dark tidings, fellow believers. 

Our numbers are increasing as more have heard the siren song of sleighbells - we sit on the precipice of $8,000 with a week left. This is thanks in part to a bevy of new rewards, add-ons, and news, all provided by a wonderful support system of creators. 

A Foreword Forewarning

**editor's warning: Grant is breaking the bit to deliver news, so just act scared when he talks**

BOO! 
Gotcha!

Greetings fellow folklore enthusiasts,

The blessings we have received have indeed pleased the sleeping winter spirits, as we have surpassed 25% funding for YULE! With just under three weeks to go we are in a fantastic spot to make it to our end goal, thanks in no small part to the generosity of you all. Thank you so much for your support and your belief, the latter of which always satisfies Gryla. **shudder**

Good morrow, weary travelers
The first two days of this campaign were like a ray of sunlight piercing the storm clouds above us: over 100 backers, over $2,000.  Pristine instruments to fight the cold. 
To reward your efforts, we wish to provide you a sweet Christmas treat: a page from the accursed Belsnickel tale. This story is rife with tension, so tread carefully as you set your sights below.

campaign.story:
MARK WAID has written a lot of comics. A lot of GREAT comics. That comic you really liked? Mark probably wrote that.
The first of four fabulous "floppies" (AKA: normal comic-cooks) focusing on IMP and one featured co-star! All the better to explore and expand the IMP-Universe!
You've already found IMPOSSIBLE JONES. To get to THE DUSK: http://bit.ly/theDUSK
WHEN TITANS CLASH! As with all stories like this, IMP and HOLLY must fight before they team-up!
Except not really! Welcome to CLUB COSPLAY, where Our Gals can hang without drawing undue attention to themselves. They meet "another" Imp cosplayer, plus a guy we affectionately refer to as "The Lunkhead"…
…Whom IMP makes short work of.
Turns out IMP "convinces" the Lunk to buy the gals a round of drinks. Kind of. (The Lunk deserves this— trust me.)
And just when everything's going Our Gals' way… well, things take a turn, fast. What happens? More like "WHO" happens…

ALL 3 COVERS— 1 LOW PRICE!

updates.update_userinfo: PENCILS & INKS: DONE! Surveys On Their Way!
updates.update_content:
Tuesdays are busy days around here— lots of meetings and kid drop-offs and pick-ups– so I barely have time to tell you all black-and-white art for the IMPOSSIBLE JONES/HOLLY DAZE book is now finished! That's the main 30-page story (which grew 2 pages since the end of the Kickstarter!) and Dan Schkade's wonderful 6-page EVEN STEVEN solo story! 
Everything's out for colors, EVEN STEVEN'S being lettered, and I'm about to start dialoguing the IMP/HOLLY story.

Wait! I Mean 4 More Pages!
Make that 5.
David and I work together very closely on IMPOSSIBLE JONES. I write the stories and David draws them, but we're both storytellers, and can often see mis-steps or weak points that the other doesn't. And we trust and respect each other enough to not be afraid to mention them.

Here's where we stand as of April 27, 2021:
The funds has been deposited in my bank account.
I arranged for the IMP/HOLLY book and the IMPOSSIBLE SKETCHBOOK to be printed by COMIC IMPRESSIONS, an excellent organization that has probably printed many comics you already own.
I ordered the FIGHT POSTER, CHIBI stickers, FIRST 48 HOURS Stickers, and IMP/CAPTAIN LANCET Imp-Print mini-print from the fine folks at Colorhaus.

I wake up this morning to see you've blown the last Stretch Goal OUT OF THE WATER! 
First: Thank You! You have carried IMP 2 far, far beyond any point I ever imagined.
Second: You know what this means, right?
The EVEN STEVEN Solo Story is now 6 PAGES!

campaign.story:
❤️ THANK YOU! ❤️
Colossal thanks to everyone who backed Bloom! We're honored and humbled by your support, and can not wait to put this groovy tale in your hands. 
For the latest please follow:
HeroTomorrow.com
Hero Tomorrow Facebook
Instagram.com/tedsikora 
Twitter.com/tedsikora
The year is 1969. Ramsey is an aspiring comic book artist who is trying to find inspiration for his femme fatale. When he meets wild dancer, Regina, at a street fair he invites her into the woods for a character photoshoot where she begins to break on through to the other side. Witness the psycho-delic origin of the most powerful character in the Hero Tomorrow Comics universe. A mind-bending 4 issue journey to reshape your reality!
Second issue 32 pages full color, glossy paper.
All physical orders will include a signed Regina print by Ted Sikora. This is the second of four to accompany each release created in an Andy Warhol homage style.
Shipping in June 2021.
Survey will give you option to have them signed for FREE.
Exclusive Publisher variants not available elsewhere.
All four issues of this series will release in 2021.
Ted Sikora (writer/creator/colorist/letterer) is a Cleveland/Akron based comic book writer and filmmaker. He is the president of Hero Tomorrow Comics, and the creator/writer/letterer of Tap Dance Killer andPunchline & the Vaude-Villains, and creator/co-writer/colorist/letterer of Apama The Undiscovered Animal. As a filmmaker he directed the indie feature Hero Tomorrow and  hundreds of shorts in realms of documentary, music videos, and  education. He wrote the libretto, principle music and lyrics for the  horror show musical Nothing Like Vaudeville. 
Butch Mapa (artist) is a professional illustrator and graphic novelist with a decade of experience, currently illustrating Marvel's Action Avengers through IDW, He's done work for Zenescope, Top Shelf, Image, Upper Deck, and many others.
Why Crowdfunding?
First, there's nothing better than having a direct connection to  readers. I'm honored to have had that experience through conventions and  Kickstarter over the past decade. Some of the most touching moments in  my life have come from people telling me they see themselves in a  character that I created. Also the interaction online with you helps  shape these campaigns. It undoubtedly makes me a better creator, which  hopefully  enhances the experience for you with each go 'round.
Secondly, BLOOM was actually solicited in the Previews Guide catalog in April of 2020, but due to the massive covid shutdown, that  particular catalog was barely distributed. We had to pull it because it  would have had no chance. Our business model relies heavily on comic  conventions, and without cons we would simply lose money on every  release. The Kickstarter platform is like a virtual comic con, and we can do things on it we can't even do at conventions. (like pick your shirt color and CGCs.)
As the industry changes we're trying to change with it.  I heartily  thank you for supporting the indies and making this moment possible.
Thank you so much for checking out our campaign.
Ted Sikora

campaign.story:
NOTE: We've hit our first THREE stretch goals and so now each and every backer will receive a print, a card set (see below), AND our BONUS DIGITAL EXTRAVAGANZA... a virtual cornucopia of books (12+) from the hottest creators in comics. So, essentially, you're now getting about 16+ comics for this one pledge.
THE JUMP is a comic book series from screenwriter Rylend Grant, artist Fabio Alves, colorist Edson Ferriera, and letterer HdE... the same twisted team that brought you Action Lab: Danger Zone's critically-lauded superhero noir BANJAX. Banjax was nominated for FOUR Mike Wieringo Comic Book Industry Awards in 2020 including BEST SERIES (along-side BITTER ROOT, SOMETHING'S KILLING THE CHILDREN, & BLACK HAMMER: AGE OF DOOM).
The first Issue of THE JUMP - launched via Kickstarter last year - received RAVE reviews. This campaign will fund the pulse-pounding second issue and hopefully we'll hit a few stretch goals along the way so we can give you more bang for your Kickstarter buck.
After a series of crippling personal tragedies, Thomas Northrope retreats from his everyday life and finds comfort in an online community dedicated to the art of astral projection. When he demonstrates a unique aptitude for the practice, Thomas becomes the target of a mysterious corporate/political machine – known as AJAX – bent on using promising young practitioners to win a centuries-old war on the astral plane.
Astral projection is the process of willfully separating one's consciousness from his or her physical body and moving it freely through the universe/the astral plane. A key philosophical concept in many Eastern cultures and religions, astral projection is regularly practiced by yogis and by devotees of certain Hindu & Buddhist sects.
Astral projection can happen spontaneously – like in near-death experiences – or it can be made to occur with practiced conscious effort. During projection, people have reported flying, passing through solid objects, seeing into the past and future, communicating with the deceased, and visiting far away planets.
The astral plane is a division of existence postulated by classical (particularly neo-Platonic), medieval, oriental, and esoteric philosophies and mystery religions. It is a dimension beyond the physical… the realm of dreams, spirits, and psychic phenomena, the substance and vehicle for contact between the material and the mystical. Some writers/philosophers conflate this realm with heaven and/or hell, with union with God itself.
In the world of The Jump, the astral plane amounts to psychic real estate… another proverbial mound of dirt to be carved up, claimed, and fought over by politicians, influential businessmen, and the cultural & religious elite.
FROM RYLEND: I’m a screenwriter by trade. For over a decade, I’ve made my living writing smart psychological thrillers for directors like JJ Abrams, Ridley Scott, Justin Lin, John Woo, Luc Besson, and F. Gary Gray, so I can’t help but think of things in cinematic terms. The Jump is a smart, high-concept sci-fi thriller full of meaty twists and turns. It is Inception meets The Bourne Identity… if it were dripping with macabre and directed by David Fincher. Now tell me that doesn’t sound cool?
Not ready to make THE JUMP with us just yet? Well, then check out this free preview of Issue 2:
I know what you're all thinking now. "That was BADASS, but what do we get if we pledge?" Well, I'm glad you asked. First, there's--
We print THE JUMP on a heavy 80 lb paper stock with a 100 lb glossy cover. Top quality, all the way. When you pick up one of our books, you'll feel the difference. This is very much a Cadillac. A heavier stock also makes the comic less likely to be damaged in transit.

THE REGULAR COVER - ALVES & FERREIRA
We're also offering three UBER-limited variant covers you'll only be able to procure here on Kickstarter. Feast your eyes on these:

B2TF HOMAGE VARIANT - ALVES & FERREIRA
Trust us... this one's heavy... and if our calculations are correct, when this baby hits 88 mph, you're gonna see some serious shit.

MANDO HOMAGE VARIANT - ALVES & FERREIRA 
You can run from this cover... but you'll only die tired.

MAGNUM P.I. VARIANT - ALVES & FERREIRA 
Better snatch this pretty little thing up before Higgins releases the Dobermans.

GREAT covers, right? Having trouble choosing just one? Well, why not GRAB THEM ALL?!
Did you miss out on Issue 1 of THE JUMP? No worries! We've got you! All four Issue 1 covers are still available (Regular cover and the Ghostbusters, Ice Cube/"Good Day," & Risque variants) RIGHT HERE!
For more info on the Issue 1 covers, check out the ISSUE 1 KICKSTARTER PAGE.
NOTE: Special "Early Bird" tiers are available for ONLY the first 48 HOURS of the campaign. Get in early and SAVE!
We're offering all sorts of other fun stuff to backers. Take a look below for the short and skinny, and please feel free to message with any specific questions.
PDFs of the Ringo Award-Nominated Banjax #1 and the Ringo Award-Winning Aberrant #1
What better way to get to know us than by taking a long look at the work we've done before? ALL backers of this Kickstarter will essentially receive THREE badass comic issues for the price of one AND...
A MEATY PREVIEW OF THE PEACEKEEPERS #1
Again, we're still getting to know each other here... so why not check out our last book/the book that just took Kickstarter by storm? The Peacekeepers is a 64-page love letter to dark, quirky crime dramas (like FARGO and NO COUNTRY FOR OLD MEN) AND YOU'RE GONNA LOVE IT!
RYLEND GRANT'S SCRIPT FOR THE JUMP #2
Love to see how the sausage gets made? Everyone who pledges the digital deluxe tier and higher will get Rylend Grant's (2019 Ringo Award nominee for BEST WRITER) scripts for Issues 2 of THE JUMP!
PUBLISHER PITCH DOCUMENT
Want to see how the pros present their ideas to real deal publishers? Everyone who pledges the digital deluxe tier and higher will get Rylend Grant's series pitch document for THE JUMP!
DIGITAL FILES FOR ALL PENCILS, INKS, & COLORS
A process junkie's DREAM! See how the book gets made from start to finish. Backers of the Digital Deluxe tier and above will receive digital files for all pencils, inks, & colors!
THE RYLEND GRANT DIGITAL LIBRARY
Get ahold of digital versions of all of Rylend Grant's work. The Ringo Award-winning ABERRANT - Seasons 1 & 2, The Ringo-nominated BANJAX - Season 1, THE JUMP #1, THE PEACEKEEPERS 1 & 2, and TALES FROM THE WORLD OF MONSTER MATADOR.
NOTE: Signed physical copies and RARE variants will be available as add-ons once you pick your tier. See info below.
ORIGINAL ART - HAND-DRAWN/INKED CHARACTERS FROM THE JUMP
Score a one-of-a kind piece of original hand-drawn/inked art from Fabio Alves. These are A5 format (roughly 6x8 inches) and feature characters from THE JUMP. 

ORIGINAL ART - B&W COMMISSION FROM FABIO ALVES 
Got something you want drawn? Well, then why not commission JUMP/BANJAX artist Fabio Alves (2020 Ringo Nominee for BEST COVER ARTIST) to draw you an original B&W pin up? You pick the subject matter.

ORIGINAL ART - FULL COLOR COMMISSION
Got something you want drawn? Fabio will still do it, but why not go the extra mile and have your piece rendered in full, beautiful color by JUMP/BANJAX Colorist Edson Ferreira (2020 Ringo Nominee for BEST COLORIST)? Again, you pick the subject matter.
PUT ME ON A COVER!
Want to go back in time? Want to don Boba Fett's armor? We will put your face/likeness on any of our covers (you choose). You then decide if you'd like a digital file and beautiful physical print or if you'd like to receive an ACTUAL PHYSICAL COMIC ISSUE WITH YOUR MUG ON IT!
 DRAW ME IN!
Score a cameo in the book! Fabio will draw you into an actual scene in THE JUMP #2.

 DRAW ME IN AND GIVE ME LINES!
Score a more prominent speaking role in the book! Fabio will draw you in as a supporting character in THE JUMP #2 and WE'LL GIVE YOU LINES OF DIALOGUE.
AN ORIGINAL JUMP STORY STARRING YOU!
We will write and draw an original 5-page story that takes place in the universe of THE JUMP that stars YOU as the protagonist!

ONE-ON-ONE SKYPE SESSION WITH RYLEND GRANT 
Rylend is a Ringo Award-winning comic creator and has spent 15+ years developing film/TV projects with folks like Ridley Scott, JJ Abrams, John Woo, & Luc Besson. Here's your chance to pick his brain during an hour-long Skype session. Need Film/TV/Comic pitch feedback? Comic book how-to? Getting your 1st book published? YOU set the agenda.

BECOME A PRODUCER
After working in Hollywood for 15+ years, Rylend has an impressive track record of setting his fiction and comic properties up as film and television projects. To date, Rylend's stories have attracted talent like JJ Abrams, Justin Lin, F. Gary Gray, Robert Deniro, and Daveed Diggs. Well, here is your chance to become a producer on the JUMP property. You'll receive the agreed upon credit in book (RIGHT NEXT TO THE WRITER, ARTIST, COLORIST, & LETTERER) and on any future films, TV shows, etc

RETAIL TIER 
Retailers can order 10 copies of our Kickstarter books - THE JUMP 1 & 2 and/or THE PEACEKEEPERS 1 & 2 (you tell us which books/covers) - at a special discounted rate and we'll throw in a ton of cool extras... signed copies of Aberrant, Banjax, & The Peacekeepers... uber rare con variants. DM for details!

We'll be going all in with Kickstarter's new Add-Ons interface this go 'round. So, we'll be offering some REALLY COOL extras for you as you check out. To start, you'll see our ENTIRE digital library, and well as plenty of signed physical copies of ABERRANT and BANJAX (single issues and TPBs)... 
You'll also see...
SIGNED JUMP #1 ISSUES
SIGNED PEACEKEEPERS 1 & 2 ISSUES
 UBER RARE CON-EXCLUSIVE VARIANTS
RYLEND GRANTVERSE TRADING CARDS - SERIES 1
If you missed out on these gems when they were offered up during the PEACEKEEPERS Kickstarter campaign, HERE is your chance to grab them... the ABERRANT Lance Cordrey F*ckface card... the BANJAX Garbage Pail Kid... the PEACEKEEPERS Wanted Poster card... the whole SERIES 1 set can be had for JUST $3... and there's FREE SHIPPPING on these for all physcial backers!
We LOVE stretch goals! And if we're lucky enough to reach our initial funding goal, we'll unlock a slew of really cool extra rewards for our backers.
-STRECH GOAL #1 - $7,000 - BONUS DIGITAL EXTRAVAGANZA! (UNLOCKED!!!)
If we can reach our $7,000 goal, we'll be giving our backers A TON of extra digital books (about a dozen) from some of the hottest creators in comics!
-STRETCH GOAL #2 - $10,000 - Exclusive Print (UNLOCKED!!!)
If we can reach $10,000, we'll be giving this stunning Mike Mignola-inspired print to all of our backers: 
-STRETCH GOAL #2 - $13,000 - Rylend Grant Comicsverse Trading Cards - SERIES 2! (UNLOCKED!!!)
A BRAND NEW set of trading cards (REVEAL TO COME) featuring characters from Rylend's greatest comic hits... Banjax, Aberrant, The Peacekeepers, and of course, The Jump. We starting building out this set (we made cards 1-3) during the Peacekeepers 1 & 2 campaign and they were a big hit. Score three more bonkers (cards 4-6) here!.
-STRETCH GOAL #2 - $16,000 - (to be revealed)
THE JUMP has sprung from the wicked minds of Hollywood screenwriter/Ringo Award-winning comic creator Rylend Grant, artist Fabio Alves, colorist Edson Ferreira, and letterer HdE... the very same team that brought you the dark and decidedly wicked superhero noir BANJAX (published Action Lab: Danger Zone).
BANJAX made over a dozen ten-best lists in 2019, it was nominated for FOUR Mike Weiringo Comic Book Industry Awards (including BEST SERIES) and the critics raved:
“This is the most amazingly well done first issue of a series I have ever seen. Point blank. Period… You cannot read this and come out if the same way you went into it… So effin’ good.” (Steven Leitman, Reading with a Flight Ring)
“Banjax has all the action, violence, grit, and heart of a classic.” (David Pepose, Creator of Spencer & Locke)
“Quality, engrossing material embedded with a cinematic feel. Gifted storytelling and breathtaking artwork. Banjax will instantly have you screaming for more!” (Jason Bennett, PopCultHQ)
“Banjax hits incredibly hard. Intense, thought-provoking, wildly entertaining. It’s near perfect. For those looking for something unique, Issue #1 is a must-read.” (Charlie Chipman, The Brazen Bull)
“Riveting. Refreshing. Heart-breaking. Ultra-violent. Honestly, a bit unsettling. The artwork of Fábio Alves is everything a dark and gritty comic should embody. Edson Ferreira’s color work adds an extra punch to really emotional panels. Don’t miss out on this bloody good time! A+” (Andrew Huard, You Don’t Read Comics)
“Holy crap this is good. This book hits all the right notes. It’s marvelously done, such a compelling story. It’s the best comic I’ve read in a long time. Honestly? Bendis could take some notes here.” (ComicCast Podcast)

And Rylend's previous book - ABERRANT - won a prestigious Mike Wieringo Comic Book Award ("Ringo Award") in 2019 for BEST VILLAIN and was nominated for two others... BEST SINGLE ISSUE and BEST WRITER (alongside Jeff Lemire, Scott Snyder, Brian K. Vaughn, and Brian Michael Bendis).
And here's what the critics had to say about ABERRANT:
“Go home, other comics people. Rylend Grant and Zsombor Huszka just killed the game…” (Charles Pulliam-Moore – i09)
“ABERRANT offers an intense, near-cinematic reading experience that incites excitement and inspires interest for issues to come.” (The Brazen Bull)
“Aberrant flat-out works. You have visceral action scenes. Personalities practically ooze out of the page. Honestly, this is the kind of storytelling that the big publishers are missing.” (Big Comic Page)
“…a bleak, dangerous and serious story with a lot at stake…. If you like revenge tales, military thrillers, and superheroes, ‘Aberrant’ has it all.” (Spartantown)
“ABERRANT #1 is a game-changer at Action Lab: Danger Zone. You’ll become captivated almost immediately… The creative team put together one of the most seamless, cohesive, and dynamic collaborations I’ve seen this year on the indie scene.” (PopCultHQ)
 And ABERRANT was quickly optioned for television by 24 & FELICITY Executive Producer Tony Krantz! 
And our last Kickstarter effort, THE PEACEKEEPERS, took the site by storm... 
"THE PEACEKEEPERS is going to make everyone on the indie scene step up their game. This is some next-level s*** that is destined to be snagged by Hollywood. The theatrical feel, the brilliant delivery, the character development, and the remarkable comic book experience you’ll get – THE PEACEKEEPERS is going to make a lot of new fans, impress current fans, and is destined for a lot more than we can possibly know. You want greatness, look no further." (Jason Bennett - PopCultHQ)
MUCH MORE LOVE TO COME ON THE JUMP!

As you can see THE JUMP was put together by one hell of a team, guys whom have already been around the block a few times together... joining us this go round, though, is an army of astral projectionist gurus – shepherds of the real-life communities upon which the one in our book is modeled. While we work to make sure The Jump appeals to a hungry American action thriller audience, these folks will be making sure we keep things authentic, grounded, and true to the astral traveler’s experience.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
THE JUMP is brought to you by a team of steadily working professionals that has collaborated previously and delivered an exceptional, critically-acclaimed, Ringo Award-nominated book. We've done two very successful Kickstarters previously (THE JUMP #1 and THE PEACEKEEPERS 1 & 2) and delivered a great product on time. We promise, you will like what you get.

Our printer - Comic Impressions - is top notch. They print all of Scout Comics titles. We've dealt with them on a half dozen projects at this point and we really can't say enough about the quality and consistency of their work. 

We're committed to delivering the best possible experience to our backers, so we're investing in top-of-the-line shipping materials, and are handling fulfillment 100% in-house. This will eliminate the risk of delivery delays and to make sure your rewards arrive in excellent condition. Most importantly, I (Rylend) will address every question personally. The buck stops here. If you have a problem... I'm here for you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey Jumpers,
  Just a quick update... cards have been charged for Backerkit add-ons and the book is headed off to the printer! I don't yet have a concrete return estimate from them as they are pretty backed up at the moment due to some pandemic-related chaos, but I'll check back in with you here as soon as I have some dates. Bonus digital content is coming soon! Stay tuned!
Let me know if you need something! Hope all is well!

updates.update_userinfo: Rylend Grant's SUICIDE JOCKEYS is coming to your local comic shop in August via Source Point Press!
updates.update_content:
Hey Jumpers,
  I hope this message find you well. I'm writing to let you know that both the regular and "Road House" variant editions of the first issue of my latest and greatest comic book series - a delightfully twisted Tokusatsu action joint, titled SUICIDE JOCKEYS - is available NOW for preorder at your local comic shop. Preorders drive everything, so help a brother out, huh? You can also have it easily shipped directly to your home by ordering online via MIDTOWN COMICS. 

SUICIDE JOCKEYS will run for 4 issues, so PUT IT ON YOUR PULL LIST!

Check out a best-in-the-business preview from Jason Bennett at PopCultHQ . And peep the official press release from Source Point Press below. Trust me, you're in for quite a ride with this one!

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys going out! EXCLUSIVE BACKER KIT VARIANT! Limited to just 35 copies!
updates.update_content:
Hey all,
Some of you will receive your Backerkit surveys tonight... the site makes you first send a "smoke test" to 5% of your backers to ferret out any problems before you go out wide. The rest of you will receive yours tomorrow morning. Remember to fill those out as quickly as possible! I essentially can't get the book off to the printer until I have the information gleaned from those surveys, so the whole enterprise currently hinges on this.
EXCLUSIVE BACKER KIT VARIANT!

updates.update_userinfo: Backerkit surveys coming! Pre-order store open!
updates.update_content:
Hey all,
  Just a heads up that your Backerkit surveys will be coming later this week... probably on Thursday. Make sure you fill those out as quickly as possible. I essentially can't get the book off to the printer until I have the information gleaned from those surveys, so the whole enterprise currently hinges on this.
As I alluded to before, there'll be plenty of fun add-on opportunities for you when you check out via Backerkit. The Backerkit storefront is actually already open if you want to check it out/preview things:

Hey all,
I just wanted to thank you very sincerely for all the love this past month. There is such an active and enthusiastic fanbase here on Kickstarter... you guys have made this such a great time... I've said it before and I'll say it again here... this is so much more fun than is putting books in comic shops.
I'm going to take a short respite for the weekend, but I'll be back early next week with more news. I'm told that your payments should be processed very soon, so make sure all your credit card info is current with Kickstarter. Once we're over that hump, I'll start contacting folks for commision and draw-me-in references. The backer surveys will come soon after that.

campaign.story:
In a dystopian world, a warrior priest travels a dangerous landscape of monsters and demons to discover a desperate plot for his soul.
War Priest Chapter 1: Enhanced Edition is a 76 page Graphic Novel.The art, lettering and cover have been updated from previous versions. This book is a full color 36 page story and the black & white artwork without word bubbles or other distractions. There will also be back-matter explaining the world of War Priest and more!
This story is a love letter to every creator and story that has ever excited me. You may see something that reminds you of something you love too!

Chapter 1:
War Priest is a story for anyone who likes swords and sorcery, monster hunting, dystopian futures or anything action packed with a little thought provocation.
In the distant future, North America has changed in every conceivable way. Several separate nations have been formed and Kingsland is one of them. Kingsland is a Theocratic/martial nation ruled by High Father Solomon III. King Solomon was divinely chosen to rule and has taken Solomon as his name. The nation is divided into 12 Wards and each is ruled by a War Priest who answers directly to the High Father. Each War Priest is chosen by the High Father and takes the name of an Apostle of Jesus.
Matthias is the War Priest this story focuses on. (Matthias was the Disciple chosen by the other 11 after Judas Iscariot betrayed Jesus.)
He is sent to the 9th Ward in search of its War Priest, Thomas.
What he finds may change everything...

What are people saying?
"It’s a gruesome, bloody brawl from beginning to end, and it’s wondrous to read. It falls somewhere between a manga and a western comic: more visual, moving quickly without much dialog or exposition. Kemp gives you everything you need and plenty of blood to dirty your blade." - Blake Morgan
https://blaketmorgan.wixsite.com/blakesbuzz-1/post/war-priest
"The world-building was fantastic, as Kemp thought of some great ways to show some unique magics. For instance, Mathias faces off against a demon that can control the properties of the plane around him. With such a popular, time-worn genre like fantasy, new and unique magic is a must." - Ryan Shimek
https://www.comicbookyeti.com/post/war-priest
"In the end, we get an epic showdown between good and evil, where both sides of the coin question the virtue of their foe’s actions. Across the 9 page battle spread, we see an epic combination of fight dialogue, multi-environmental battles, and bloodshed.  There is a big cliffhanger at the end of the book that leaves me with so many questions hoping that War Priest #2 comes out quickly! What does the outcome of the battle in the 9th ward mean for Kingsland? What are other War Priests doing at this time? Are there scarier and more powerful magic users we have yet to be introduced to? And so much more!" - CB Poser
https://www.comicbookposer.com/the-blog/poserpreviews-1-war-priest

Mark Pate: Pencil and Ink
Mark Pate is an award-winning illustrator living and working in Queens, NY with his wife, Elizabeth. He grew up in Mesa, Arizona with a passion for sequential story-telling and received a Bachelor of Fine Art (BFA) from Arizona State University.
Mark has worked as a freelance illustrator for over 10 years. His work includes book cover art and design, storyboard art for film and television, character/environment concept art, illustration for publication and animation, and sequential art for comic books.
In addition to his illustration work, Mark is the Associate Director of the Transform artist residency organization which hosts art residencies across the country. In his work, Mark hopes to elicit joy, laughter, excitement and thoughtful reflection.
Stonie Williams: Color
Raised in the back of a comic book store and weaned on sci-fi conventions, Stonie Williams is a 36 yr old married father of 5 and a self-styled Bard. He plays guitar and tells stories through script and prose, as well as comic book coloring and dabbling in lettering. His first endeavor into comics, ‘Villainous’, published by Mad Cave Studios, was the publisher’s first foray into the superhero genre.

campaign.story:
The Deadliest Bouquet is a five-part, full-color original comic written by Erica Schultz,  drawn by Carola Borelli, and colored by Gab Contreras. 
In 1998, three estranged sisters trained by their Nazi-hunting mother, Jasmine, come together to solve Jasmine's murder…and try not to kill each other in the process.

Follow Rose, Poppy, and Violet in a new 128 page graphic novel from Ringo Award nominated writer Erica Schultz (Daredevil), interior artist Carola Borelli (Destiny, NY), colorist Gab Contreras (TRVE KVLT), and editor James Emmett (I Am Hexed, 451 Media) with a fabulous cover by Kevin Wada (Scarlet Witch).
 Rose, Poppy, and Violet Hawthorn had an unusual upbringing. Their mother, Jasmine, was the daughter of Nazi hunters, and indoctrinated into La Résistance after WW2. After moving to the U.S., Jasmine settled down and had three daughters, but her hard-lived past caught up with her. 
The Deadliest Bouquet explores what happens when Rose, Poppy, and Violet have to put their resentment toward each other aside in order to find Jasmine's killer. This is a family of secrets…and they're all about to be laid bare.
Art by Carola Borelli and Gab Contreras.
Art by Carola Borelli
Violet feels her mother, Jasmine, was holding her back by teaching them all these amazing skills and then not letting them use them, which is why she freelances as a hit-woman while modeling overseas. She never backs down from a fight and is known to instigate one when she’s bored. Violet is a Taurus. 
Art by Carola Borelli
Poppy hated growing up in a house so filled with secrets. Poppy’s husband, Derek, is oblivious to her family’s history and Poppy’s training. He just thinks she’s a stay at home mom and part-time bookkeeper. Poppy is a Cancer.
Art by Carola Borelli
Rose feels obligated to help Jasmine run the flower shop since she's the oldest and most responsible. She resents her sisters for leaving and having lives of their own. Rose is a Capricorn.
Art by Carola Borelli
Jasmine was trained in the art of espionage and assassination by her parents who were part of La Résistance in WW2. She lived all over the world hunting down escaped Nazis with her family but left after her brother's death on a particular mission. She resisted raising her girls the same way, but is pushed to the edge. Her death is what brings Rose, Poppy, and Violet together. Jasmine is a Pisces.
Art by Kevin Wada.
Art by Carola Borelli and Gab Contreras.
Art by Carola Borelli and Gab Contreras.
Art by Carola Borelli and Gab Contreras.
Art by Carola Borelli and Gab Contreras.
WIP Print by Alane Grace
Erica Schultz is comic book writer and editor known for her work at Marvel (Daredevil), DC (Hawkgirl), Image (Where We Live), Red 5 (Legacy of Mandrake) and others. She was part of DC Comics' first Talent Development Workshop, and is the creator of the five-time Ringo nominated series Forgotten Home with comiXology Originals. 
Carola Borelli was born and raised in southern Italy and moved to Rome to attend the University of Architecture and the International School of Comics. In 2019 she collaborated with Space Between Entertainment for Destiny: NY Vol. 3. She often works with A Wave Blue World and other indie publishers.
Gab Contreras is a comic book colorist, graphic designer, and illustrator from Lima, Peru. She has worked on several books for various publishers, most notably Dead Beats (A Wave Blue World), 2000 AD Summer Special 2018 (2000 AD), 20 Fists (Source Point Press), and others. Gab is currently working on Witchblood (Vault Comics), TRVE KVLT, and a couple of TBA projects.
James Emmett is a freelance comic book editor based out of Brooklyn, NY. He is the editor and creative director on the series I Am Hexed. His clients have included Marvel Entertainment, 451 Media, Mezco Toyz, Wayward Raven and more!
Kevin Wada has been a working cover artist for the last 10 years. His process of marrying watercolors and digital gives his work a distinct and modern feel.  He's contributed to books like She-Hulk, Iceman, Catwoman, Runaways, the Simon Snow series, and more! 
Alane Grace is a Filipino-American Illustrator & Design artist living in Pasadena, CA. In recent years, she has credited work as a background painter for Crunchyroll's Onyx Equinox and Hulu's Solar Opposites. She loves to draw a certain winter spirit and a fairy queen.

campaign.story:
"THE ROAD meets THE CALL OF CTHULHU"
ABYSSAL ALBION the CTHULHU MYTHOS inspired ELDRITCH SURVIVAL HORROR comic series is back with issue 2!
Set after the rise of the GREAT OLD ONES and the fall of humanity. ABYSSAL ALBION takes place in a GREAT BRITAIN where both cosmic and folk terrors are a commonplace and chilling truth.  
Ravaged by death and madness, the series follows the continuing journey of two siblings, SISTER and BROTHER, as they try to survive a world teeming with savage cults and sanity shattering beasts.
 If you are a fan of nightmarish post-apocalypses, doom-laden horror,  and mind bending cosmic dread, this is the series for you! Where our first issue dove head-first into the nightmare filled depths of the British woodlands, the second takes us to its now less than idyllic coastlines.
Though it’s not only overly aggressive seagulls, and the unpredictable British weather our pair will have to contend with.  In their search for Sisters estranged partner the pair face the horrifying and  grotesque -  DEEP ONES.
Half-man, half-fish hybrid,  worshippers of the colossal ancient deity DAGON, Deep Ones now inhabit and control the worlds coastal towns and ports.
Continuing on from our previous 28 Page issue, we shall continue to deliver a unique look at a very weird apocalypse, stunningly drawn in B&W.  
With your support we are set to deliver another quality issue, delving even further into the unknown world of ABYSSAL ALBION.
Written by cosmic horror aficionado, screenwriter, and creative producer for the DEADBOLT Films, THOMAS J CAMPBELL (BEYOND, AND NOTHING HURT) and with artwork by accomplished artist WAYNE LOWDEN (PLAINER JANE, NOCTURNE), lettering by KEN REYNOLDS (COGNITION, HERE AND THERE) and cover colours by TRILBY BLACK.
ABYSSAL ALBION is filled with exciting and spine-chilling homages to the CTHULHU MYTHOS and hopes to continue the tradition of the originators of weird fiction, H.P Lovecraft, Ambrose Bierce, Robert W. Chambers, Charlotte Gilman Perkins, Arthur Machen, amongst others.
Drawn in striking and suitably atmospheric Black and White by WAYNE LOWDEN, with art that perfectly captures the strange and chaotic world our protagonists now find themselves in.
The book itself will be printed on 120gsm uncoated paper to give the pages a slightly rough, more visceral texture, and will feature a 200gsm full colour gloss laminate cover.


BIG COMIC PAGE
"Imagine if you will a story that is similar to The Walking Dead, but instead of zombies shambling across the pages, you have the creeping, insidious horrors spawned by Cthulhu and the rest of his star-spawned family. Okay, I’m not saying that this is another Walking Dead, but it definitely has a similar vibe, and the same potential to be an epic saga given half a chance."
3 MILLION YEARS
"This is a real page turner, with some excellent scenes, art, lettering and storytelling. Hopefully, there is more to come from this world – those with little knowledge of the Lovecraft mythos will enjoy this as much as those who have more."
COMIC BOOK NEWS UK 
"Wayne Lowden  really delivers something special here. It’s art that oozes with unsettling qualities, encapsulating the darkness literally and metaphorically. I like it, I like it a lot. There’s a tangible menace that leaked off the pages for me. Panel after panel delivers incredible detail and emotional weight. It’s a heavy sketch style of monochrome brilliance, rich in shading that just sets a wonderfully dark atmosphere."
THE CONVENTION COLLECTIVE 
"As can be expected, a story in the horror genre deserves some parental discretion. There is cursing and some violence as well as some scary imagery that skews this title towards older readers."
 MIDLIFEGAMERGEEK.COM 
"The intriguing events of the issue set us up nicely to learn more about the siblings and their surroundings as we continue to follow their struggle for survival. With the first issue having come to life with the aid of a successful crowdfunding campaign, I shall be keeping a very keen eye out for the second issue’s launch on Kickstarter."
 Of course you'll need supplies if you're to survive in the harsh world of ABYSSAL ALBION - so by backing us here is just some of what you can get!
25mm CTHULHU Pin Badge
25mm ABYSSAL ALBION Pin Badge

Original Art Prints

 As we hit our target and issue two becomes a reality, we'll be releasing a bunch of stretch goals. 
First of which being a unique A4 Mythos Inspired art print commissioned specially for ABYSSAL ALBION from the fantastic Davey Jebadiah Sewell - A master of occult and gothic horror imagery, a couple examples of his beautiful work can be seen below below.
Should we go beyond even further then we have an art  variant by Canadian horror artist and illustrator Trevor Henderson.
Known most famously for his unsettling “SIRENHEAD” creature,  as well as a myriad of other terrifyingly creepy cryptids and weird imagery. As anyone who is aware of Trevor's incredible work will attest, expect something truly uncanny and horrifying.
Keeping with the tradition of a unique campaign video that gives a glimpse into the setting wider ABYSSAL ALBION setting via short film,  SOLITUDE was shot alone during lockdown to serve as further worldbuilding into the world of ABYSSAL ALBION.

Welcome to "Tales of the 399!"
 Hi! Thanks for taking a look at “Tales of the 399.” 
We’re students at Moravian College, a small liberal arts school in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania. We are a class of English majors and minors, and we all have passion for writing. Some of us have made comics before, while others have not. Throughout this semester, we’ve learned a lot about the creative process of comic-making in our Comics and Graphic Storytelling class, or English 399. This collection showcases our new skills.
“Tales of the 399” is a collection of memoirs, each written by one of us. When choosing a personal experience to illustrate, we focused on the theme of family. Some of our stories are lighthearted, while others are more serious, but each of our unique views of family bind them together.
We’ve never attempted to publish a book on this scale before, and we’re excited for others to see and read our work! We’d greatly appreciate your support, as this means a lot to us as students and as authors. Our ultimate goal is to be able to print full-color copies of our collection, to distribute copies directly to you, and to gain meaningful experience in promoting and publishing our creative labors. Putting our work out into the world for the first time is scary and exciting at the same time, and we would greatly appreciate your contribution to our journey.
Previews
Here's a look at some of the eight stories included in this inaugural issue:
"The Art Kids" by Grace Gilbert
"Luke 15:20" by Sam Riley
"The Half-Beating Heart" by Evan Yandrisovitz
"Same Old New Year's" by Anna Litofsky
Rewards
Our best reward, we hope, is the book itself! We've got both digital and print options available. In addition, we're working on making pins, stickers and prints to offer for something extra. We're also offering a limited number of signed and remarked editions. If you choose this reward, you'll received a signed book with a small head sketch on the cover from one of the artists!
If we reach our initial goal, we'll have a few stretch goals, too!
About the creators:
Caroline Flora (“Distant Whistle”) - Caroline is a senior majoring in English. She loves writing, reading, cherry blossoms, and playing board games.
Grace Gilbert (“The Art Kids”) - Grace is a senior majoring in English and Spanish and minoring in Art. She enjoys drawing, reading, running, and learning new things.
Chelsea Hill (“The Seventh Grade” ) - Chelsea is a senior majoring in Environmental Science with a separate degree in Philosophy. She enjoys film and spends a good amount of time outdoors. Oh, and she has a cat too.
Anna Litofsky (“Same Old New Year’s”, cover illustrator) - Anna is a junior majoring in Graphic Design and English. She loves drawing, writing, and escaping into the worlds of video games, animation, and of course, comics.
Seth Rappaport ("Island of Value") - Seth is a senior majoring in English. He likes watching movies, sleeping, and burns a lot of calories by running away from his responsibilities.
S. Riley (“Luke 15:20”) - Sam is a senior majoring in English with a writing arts certification. She enjoys writing, crochet, sleeping, and photosynthesizing when the weather’s nice.
Evan Yandrisovitz (“The Half-Beating Heart”) - Evan is a junior majoring in English. He enjoys watching movies, television shows, and playing video games in his free time. His favorite genre is horror.
Jeff McClelland teaches the class.

WHO IS THE KILLING THE GODS?
FALLEN IS BACK!
The FALLEN series is back with it's 3rd issue in a 6 part series. Each issue is 22 pages, full colour and printed on standard American sized comic format on high quality paper.  FALLEN blends the genres of mystery and fantasy by creating a thrilling mythological noir story for mature readers. The story takes place in the vibrant, synth-pop filled era of the 1980's in the loud, crowded streets of New York City.
FALLEN 3 continues along as Casper Clay hunts for clues on who killed his boss Zeus. As he starts to pull on the threads woven throughout the criminal underworld of gods, more questions begin to pop up. As he gets closer to the truth, invisible walls begin to close in on him and if he's not careful he could be next.
Issue 3 Cover

Are you ready for FALLEN?
If you backed the first 2 issues you will really enjoy this one but if you're just getting on board now and you like any of these things, you're going to love FALLEN;
80's Pop Culture - FALLEN is inspired by and infused with a lot of the 80's classics from music,  movies and style.
Mythology - Doesn't matter if you're a fan of Greek, Norse or any other mythology, FALLEN is going to touch on it all.
Crime Thriller - If you're intrigued by stories of crime, murder and mystery. It's like a mash up of John Wick, Constantine and Clash of the Titans.
FALLEN is inspired by neo-noir stories like Blade Runner, Blade Runner 2049 and fantasy stories like Fables and The Wolf Among Us.

Matt:  Writer of FALLEN. Matt has been working on the concept for the story for over 2 years. Hey everyone!

A big welcome to all of the new backers! Thank you everyone for supporting this project! We're a mere $326 (CAD) away from unlocking our first Stretch Reward and I've decided to reveal it early! As physical backers from FALLEN 2 Kickstarter recall, one of the stretch rewards was a really cool Ragnarok MC button (just like the Norse gods!). I've had several questions now about backers interested in the soundtrack of FALLEN. What happens now? Well now we set our sights on the first stretch reward. At $5000 the identity of the secret stretch reward will be revealed! That's a pretty big total but we still have the majority of the campaign time left!

campaign.story:
Hail to the King, baby

WHAT IF JACK KIRBY CREATED DRACULA? 
The result would have been terrifying, cosmic, and absolutely epic in scale. In other words, it would be a whole lot like... 
WHAT IS THE SOLAVORE?
The Eater of Dawns
Like a vampire needs blood, so the ancient evil known as THE SOLAVORE needs the energy of a sun. Absent for centuries from the far-off galaxy of the Morrigen people, the Solavore had disappeared into the realm of myth. But now, with one of their solar systems facing a cosmic loss, the Morrigen are learning that the Solavore is not only real... but hungry.

 WHO IS HUNTING IT? 
For years, the Galactic Kingdom of the Morrigen had been protected by its latest ruler, the brave and brilliant KING THEOSIS. Committed to the freedom and safety of his people, King Theosis has lead the Morrigen through decades of darkness, striving toward a future of progress and peace. But after so many battles, Theosis's beard has gone white; the grip on his sword has grown weaker.  And after a devastating personal loss, Theosis must summon a strength he's never known to defeat the worst threat the Morrigen have ever seen.
Fortunately for Theosis, his husband ABBINOIR will be there to help. Wise and compassionate as any ruler his people have served, Abbinoir is Theosis's personal strength. While the king is looking out for the kingdom, Abbinoir looks out for its king. And though he's been doing it for all of Theosis's reign, every new threat weighs more on his mind, none more so than the Solavore. After all, how can you protect a man who must protect a kingdom?
Not that he won't have help. In facing this unheard-of crisis, Theosis will have at his command some of the best warriors in the entire galaxy: his own royal guard and the elite female warriors known as the VALKINAE. Together, they make up the best defense the Morrigen have.
But will they be enough?

SNEAK PREVIEW
Check out some of the (not finalized) pages of HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE.
(Pages not final)
(Pages not final)
(Pages not final)
 WHO IS CREATING HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE? 
LANE LLOYD - Creator of the weird and zany, Lane is an up and coming artist with an energetic, off the wall style. After being featured on Comic Book Yeti, Outright Geekery, and The Driving Creators Network, Lane's comic GOD-PUNCHER smashed its way onto Kickstarter, receiving more than double the projected amount of funding.  With HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE, Lane uses their skill of designing strange, larger-than-life characters to tell a story that's both firmly planted in the horror genre and stretched to the outer limits of science fiction.
GRANT DeARMITT - Grant's tales of the sinister and strange have been published at Haw Creek Horror, Crystal Lake Publishing, and Black Hole Entertainment.  A lifelong fan of weird fiction and fantasy epics, Grant hopes HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE will present the human side of cosmic terror; an otherworldly story that hits home.

WHY ARE THEY CREATING IT?
King Theosis's ship. For interplanetary travel... and beyond.
Lane and Grant have spent two years developing the shocking showdown of Theosis and the Solavore. They made this Kickstarter to bring that story to life in the form it deserves: the comic book format.  But there is another reason. 
HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE is just one story of thousands set in this all-new universe that Lane and Grant have cooked up. Getting it created, printed, and into the hands of readers like yourself is the first step in telling those tales. We believe that comic fans are hungry for new worlds and new terrors, and we believe we have some great ones to offer.
So by backing this project, you're not just helping us make a comic. You're opening a door to another galaxy, and all the heroes and horrors that live there.

Gardener is a 232+ page Space Western graphic novel that I've been drawing for the last three years.
Incredibly, we reached funding in just 12 hours! So now we're working to unlock these stretch goals.
 $20,000 UNLOCKED- I'll include Preserves, a seven page short story that has been out of print since 2019 and the first story set in the Gardener world in the book printing.
   $25,000 UNLOCKED- Gardener gets a 6-10 page epilogue
   $30,000 UNLOCKED- I'll add a guest Pin Up illustration gallery from some of my favorite artists, including - Liana Kangas, Marie Enger, Artyom Trakhanov, Drew Shields, and more!
   $35,000 UNLOCKED - Ribbon bookmark added to print copies of the book
   $40,000 UNLOCKED - Cloth Spine added to the book
   $45,000 UNLOCKED - Expanded backmatter section added to the book

 $60,000 - Gilded Page Edges added to the book

 $100,000 - I will grow a real plant and document it through monthly posts on Instagram.
  What is GARDENER?
A touch of biopunk, a smattering of body horror, and a whole lot of mystery, this book is my love letter to all of the sci-fi/adventure stories I grew up with. It’s a chance for us to spend time with those complicated, weird, monstrous characters that maybe weren't all bad.
Gardener is set centuries after a corporation’s failed attempt at colonizing a desert planet. The employees they abandoned have gone to great lengths to survive, with autonomous robots, creatures, and former humans all trying to find their place on an alien planet. 
We follow Lars, an ex-Junker, hired by an ancient robot, The Disciple, to investigate the emergence of a strange plague that threatens to destroy all remaining life. But as the mystery unfurls, we find that there’s more to Lars than the battered robot lets on.

I’ve been working on the world of Gardener since 2016, released the first chapter in March 2018, and now am very excited to finally share the complete arc with its fans. My goal is to have one beautifully designed, high quality copy of the book, that every physical tier backer will be able to enjoy - including any additional stretch goal upgrades.
GARDENER Cover
This will be a 232+ page hardcover book US standard size comic - 6.625 x 10.25" - with signature sewn binding and an embossed title. Inside this deluxe cover you'll find:
Seven chapters that tell Gardener's completed story. Roughly 200 pages of story and their respective chapter covers.
A collection of curated back matter including early character designs and world building concepts.
 Hand drawn and colored art by MATT EMMONS (me!), Lettering by BERNARDO BRICE.
 Pending stretch goal unlocks, I’ll be able to add Preserves, a seven page short story, a 6-10 page epilogue, a cloth spine, pin ups from artists such as Marie Enger, Liana Kangas, Artyom Trakhanov, and more! 
Mockup *final book design subject to change*


In terms of production, Chapters 1-6 are inked and colors are almost complete. Chapter 7 inks are on track to be done before the end of this campaign.  The funding for the project will go to pay for lettering every chapter, book and merch printing, as well as the to rest of the creative team who are helping make this book, and the campaign itself, a hell of a lot nicer.

Risks and challenges
As with anything, there are risks of things not going exactly according to plan due to printing delays or a global pandemic, etc. - but this is my third Kickstarter and the first time I'm also not working with other artists, so I can be much more in control of production.
I have been making and self publishing comics for the last 5 years so I know I have a steady workflow down that will keep this book on track, and I have worked with the printer I will be using for Gardener previously on Dagger Dagger, so there's no question on quality and reliability.

updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone!
I can't believe it's only been a month since Gardener's Kickstarter campaign ended, somehow it feels much, much longer than that but that may be because I've been plugging away at coloring the book nonstop since then. As of tonight I have 66 pages left to color and have been moving right along with that. Once I finish the colors I'll be heading to the epilogue and then it'll be off to print!

It still feels so surreal to have received this massive outpouring of support for Gardener. At risk of repeating myself, thank you all so much for making this happen, and making every single upgrade to the book happen as well. I've finished drawing and inking the entire book aside from the epilogue and a few bonus drawings I'll be including in the back-matter section, and will be diving into colors so I can send Bernardo as much as I can at once to give him plenty of time to work on lettering while I finish the rest. We should be right on track for shipping out in September, and I'll keep up an update or two with some new page artwork so you can all know how it's progressing.

We're down to our last 20 hours for the campaign! This has been exhilarating and I can't believe we've all but knocked out every (realistic) stretch goal. The book now has an epilogue, a bonus short story, a pin up gallery, a cloth ribbon bookmark, a cloth spine, an expanded back-matter section, and is so close to reaching those gilded pages. That brings the book closer to 260ish pages compared to the initial 232 pages, it's all because of you! Seriously, thank you from every corner of my heart for making this book happen, and with such a flood of support.

We're just shy of only seven days left in the campaign and we knocked one of the bonus stretch goals out already, meaning an expanded back matter section! I'm excited that I won't have to be cutting any of the behind the scenes and preliminary drawings that led to this story. Thank you all so much for making this all possible. As an additional way to say thanks, I thought I'd share the first chapter how it was when I initially finished it three years ago. The final chapter for the book itself has a few color edits, and will of course feature Bernardo's much, much better lettering compared to my initial shaky-handed attempt, but I thought it might be fun to share. As we get towards the end, we're still closing in on our last upgrade stretch goal - gilded pages! Sharing this Kickstarter with others is a huge way to help us get there.

I can't believe we hit all of the serious stretch goals I'd initially planned in the first half of the campaign! Not that the plant part of it isn't serious - I promise I'll take good care of a plant if we get there. 
Since we hit them so quickly, I wanted to figure out a few other options to make this book even nicer for everyone. So, we came up with two more goals: an expanded backmatter section which would include early character concepts and world building pieces of Gardener, and the addition of gilded pages to the book.

I just wanted to say thank you all so much for keeping the momentum going on Gardener. I can't believe we've already unlocked 4 Stretch Goals in just over a week! I'd been hoping to get all of these upgrades in the book, but to see these stretchgoals get unlocked so quickly is truly mind blowing.

It hasn't even been a full week and you all already helped us unlock 3 Stretch Goals! That means the Pin Up Gallery will now be included in the book, along with Preserves and the Epilogue! I'm at nearly a complete loss for words and so grateful for all of the support.
Our next stretch goal of $35,000 will add a pink ribbon bookmark to the book. You can keep helping us get there - while upgrading your book at the same time - by spreading the word about Gardener! You can share this link with anyone that would dig Gardener: https://bit.ly/GardenerKS We also had a great suggestion to offer additional copies of the book as Add Ons, so those are now available as well!

I can't believe it - we've unlocked 2 stretch goals in the first three days and Kickstarter was gracious enough to list Gardener as a "Project We Love"! Thank you all so much for the tremendous support.
I had a good feeling we'd hit our funding goal but never expected to hit it within 12 hours of launch!

campaign.story:
ThoughtScape Comics is an anthology series serving up sci-if action, thrills and chills in the tradition of 2000 AD, Black Mirror and The Twilight Zone. 
Anything is possible in these taut tales of trauma and transformation, of people pushed past their limits by the gods and monsters they meet - or become - at the edges of reality.
Each issue will run approximately 44 pages and feature both serialized and self-contained stories written by me, Matt Mair Lowery (Dark Horse Comics’ Lifeformed), and drawn by some of the most compelling artists in indie comics today. Oh, and each issue will have a killer cover from one of my favorite artists. And gorgeous graphic design/packaging from one of my oldest friends, multimedia artist John Larsen. The series is planned to run eight or more issues (with a Kickstarter for each issue).
THOUGHTSCAPE #1 HAS HIT ITS FUNDING GOAL, but we're not done yet!
*** STRETCH GOAL ***
If we can hit $10,500 before the KS ends, I'll add a FIFTH STORY to TSC #1! THE GRIEVER, drawn by Jacob Edgar and colored by Lesley Atlansky! This story is of my favorite things I've ever written, and I'd LOVE to add it to the very first issue of ThoughtScape Comics. Here's a peek (the art is all done, I just need to letter it)...
More about ThoughtScape Comics #1!
Here’s what I’ve got lined up (completed and ready for print!!!) for issue #1:
A beautiful, bonkers cover from JENNA CHA (Vault Comics’ Black Stars Above):
 ThoughtScape 2319: Part 1 
Odessa Query, a Thought & Information Service Collection Officer, patrols her deep space beat, collecting thoughts harvested from the ether at the edge of the galaxy. When Odessa investigates a grisly crime aboard a space church, she begins to uncover a demonic, trans-dimensional conspiracy. Glorious water-colored art by DAVE LAW (The Space Odditorium). (Ongoing serial, 7 pages)
ThoughtScape 2319 Preview Art
A Spy Without a Face
A group of assassins gets more than they bargained for when they attack a secret laboratory in this hardboiled, balls-out extreme violence suspenser. I wrote this one specifically for master of comic book action TYRELL CANNON (ERIS, Beef Bros.) to go absolutely nuts with, and he go nuts he did… ten glorious, viciously beautiful black and white pages. (Self-contained story, 11 pages)
A Spy Without A Face Preview Art
Adorable Orphans
Meet the season’s hottest toy trend: LifeTech’s Adorable Orphan android dolls... just don’t turn your back on them. Eye-popping art from LISA NAFFZIGER (TAKING BACK TOKU). (Self-contained story, 10 pages)
Adorable Orphans Preview Art
 Ex Post Facto: A Dash Varrick Misadventure, 
Part 1
A bit revolutionary, a bit private investigator, tormented Dash Varrick travels across thought and time to unravel unsolved crimes and the mysteries of his own strange past. Or does he? Mind-bending mixed media art by KARL SLOMINSKI (Scout Comics’ Cult of Icarus). (Ongoing serial, 7 pages)
Ex Post Facto: A Dash Varrick Misadventure Preview Art
As you can see, ThoughtScape Comics is eclectic by design. The main driver of this project is my interest in exploring the wide-ranging storytelling possibilities of comics and working within as many styles and approaches as possible - plus, I want to collaborate with, and share the work of, some of the most talented comics artists I’ve come across - so variety is a big part of the mission. 
Speaking of those great artists and their work, issue #1 of ThoughtScape Comics is already complete and ready to print. So, once we hit the goal, the book can hit the presses, and be in your hands post-haste.


WHAT FOLKS ARE SAYING ABOUT THOUGHTSCAPE...
"ThoughtScape Comics is the quintessential, beautifully packaged and expertly made serialized sci-fi anthology that comics needs right now." -Liana Kangas: Trve Kvlt, She Said Destroy, Black AF: Devil's Dye
"Fantastic, artistically diverse and engaging stories of a cool far future world, all tied together with prodigious panache by writer Matt Mair Lowery.  I appreciate the creative use of swearing in the sci fi world of LifeTech." - Farel Dalrymple: THE OFTEN WRONG, Proxima Centauri, IT WILL ALL HURT, Pop Gun War, The Wrenchies, Prophet, Omega the Unknown
"A brilliant and beautiful distillation of the best things in both sci fi short stories and comics! ThoughtScape Comics is as captivating as it is haunting, each story building another cluster of characters and concepts that'll keep you thinking for days to come. I want precisely another 99 issues of this, please." - Ryan K Lindsay - Everfrost, Eternal, Deer Editor
"In rapid, percussive bursts of subversive energy, ThoughtScape tells stories of co-opted thoughts, programmed individualism, and unknown privacy in an infinite universe. Matt Mair Lowery and a startling array of artists have produced a splatter painting of the present in the colors of the future. This is a breath of endorphin-spiked, synthetic pseudo-air pumped in directly from a suffocating hereafter." - George Pendle, journalist and author of Strange Angel: The Otherworldly Life of Rocket Scientist John Whiteside Parsons
“It takes a Herculean effort to develop new comics, especially when you’re going it alone, where you’re responsible for everything from finding the right collaborative talent to handling the logistical nightmares of crowdfunding and fulfillment. And then along comes Matt Mair Lowery, delivering an entire anthology of new work—groundbreaking, thoughtful new stories to make the rest of us look bad.  I HATE YOU, MATT MAIR LOWERY!!!”- Eric Palicki, Writer (BLACK’S MYTH, ATLANTIS WASN’T BUILT FOR TOURISTS, NO ANGEL). Ringo-nominated editor (DEAD BEATS, ALL WE EVER WANTED).
“A poignant new sci-fi anthology series, Thoughtscape delivers evocative artwork and does what great science fiction is supposed to, which is make you think.” - Zack Kaplan, Writer, ECLIPSE, PORT OF EARTH, LOST CITY EXPLORERS, JOIN THE FUTURE.
“[ThoughtScape 2319] is next level. You're drawn in with the science fiction, but then you get sucker-punched when you realize it's actually a horrifying story.” - Pulp 716, Will Eisner Spirit of Comics Nominee comics retailer, Buffalo/Niagara Falls

REWARDS
ThoughtScape Comics #1
As previewed above. 44 pages of sci-fi action,  thrills, chills and mind games! 
PDF Process Zine
Go behind the scenes on all the stories in ThoughtScape Comics #1. Branding and graphic design development! Character sketches! Script pages! Art process from thumbnails to final pages! If you're a comic creator, or love process and commentary, or just want some wonderful bonus art, you'll want to grab this. Here's a peek at the kind of material you'll find in the zine...
Character designs, like this early ink sketch of Odessa Query from ThoughtScape 2319 artist Dave Law!
Raw Tyrell Cannon pencils!
Layouts from Lisa Naffziger!
A script page from me and Karl's Dash Varrick story!
ThoughtScape Trading Cards!
A moment from each of ThoughtScape Comics #1's four stories, captured on a trading card inspired by the Star Wars and Battlestar Galactica card packs I bought as a kid (I'm old). I can still remember the smell of bubblegum and newsprint... Anyway, great art on the front, fun info and/or process art on the back. 
ThoughtScape Trading Card example
Posters!
ThoughtScape goodness for your walls! Two posters! Jenna Cha's glorious cover for ThoughtScape #1 and Dave Law's title image for ThoughtScape 2319, Part One, both at 11"x17".
Two from Tyrell Cannon: DRONES
Own a piece of ThoughtScape history! TSC was born out of a series of short comic stories I originally printed for sale at cons in 2020, including DRONES, a fantastic piece of Tyrell Cannon drawn/inked/toned/lettered goodness (script by me). If you're a Tyrell fan or completist, you'll want a copy of this standalone, limited-run version of our 14-page story (fair warning/full transparency, this story may show up later in a ThoughtScape Comics issue).
Hey, kids! ThoughtScape PLUS Lifeformed
ThoughtScape for you AND something to read with your kids: a 14-page comic with two short stories featuring Cleo, the hero of me and Cassie Anderson's YA sci-fi series Lifeformed. 
 ** JUST ADDED! ThoughtScape PLUS LIFEFORMED GRAPHIC NOVELS!!! ** 
ThoughtScape for you AND EVEN MORE to read with your kids: TWO 200-PAGE GRAPHIC NOVELS! LIFEFORMED: CLEO MAKES CONTACT and LIFEFORMED: HEARTS AND MINDS - from the critically acclaimed YA SCI-FI series by ThoughtScape writer Matt Mair Lowery and artist extraordinaire Cassie Anderson.
Lifeformed: Cleo Makes Contact
"Orphaned in the wake of an alien invasion, 11-year-old Cleo must leave behind the life she knew to fight for her own survival and the Earth’s future. With the help of a rebel alien posing as her dad, Cleo learns how to survive and strike back against the invaders. Battling their way through the wreckage of the apocalypse, these two unlikely companions bond, ponder what it means to be human, and search for reasons to carry on." 
Lifeformed: Hearts and Minds
GET IN TOUCH
Have a question not answered above? Or maybe you're interested in covering this project in print, web or podcast? Drop me a line at mattmlpdx@gmail.com. I'd love to chat it up.

INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING
I'm not offering shipping outside of the U.S. as part of the Kickstarter this time, but feel free to reach out if you're wanting a physical copy of any of the rewards and we'll work something out: mattmlpdx@gmail.com.

If any challenges come up due to COVID or other unforeseen issues, you'll know ASAP. I'm nothing if not an over-communicator, just ask my collaborators.

A quick note to let you know that this week I approved the electronic proof of ThoughtScape Comics #1 from the printer, and now it's on to some hard copy proofing. updates.update_content:
Happy Monday, ThoughtScape backers!
I'll keep this REAL brief, as I am deep in the doing of last minute tasks related to getting the files for ThoughtScape Comics #1 ready to send to the printer TODAY, but I wanted to let you know about Karl Slominski's upcoming Kickstarter for EVERMORE FALLS!
Karl is, of course, the amazing artist of ThoughtScape Comics' Ex Post Facto: A Dask Varrick Misadventure, and EVERMORE FALLS is the first of a bunch of solo projects Karl is releasing this year. Go give it a follow so you can be among the first backers of this excellent original ALL-AGES fantasy graphic novel about saving the world from MONSTERS! You don't want to miss this. I mean, look at that teaser image!

Hello ThoughtScape Comics gang!
First, the big news, KS funds made their way into my bank account this morning. For the crowdfunding process nerds or creators among you considering or running a Kickstarter, here's how the $ breaks down for TSC #1 (fellow KS campaigners, watch out for dropped pledges, I caught on too late to effectively follow up with a few folks to have them try and update their payment methods) ...

Hey all!
Just a quick note to let you know what's up with ThoughtScape Comics #1!
I think I'll be receiving funds from KS next week. In the meantime I am doing the pre-press work, prepping files for the comic for print. A lot of time in Adobe InDesign.  Shouldn't be too much longer before I have this thing all set for the presses.

Wow, was it really only Monday that the campaign ended? I guess this was a long week...
I'll keep this brief, or try to, because I have files to prep for print.
Status report:
We're in the middle now of the two-week window during which Kickstarter collects pledge payments. Funds will make their way to me in another nine days or so it sounds like.
Update coming this weekend, in the meantime I thought I’d share some sick inks from Luke Horsman for our story Out of the Mouths of Babes, slated for ThoughtScape Comics #4! Enjoy!

We did it!
Thanks to all of you, ThoughtScape Comics #1 was successfully funded, and then some. AND OVER 400 BACKERS! This being my first Kickstarter, I really had no idea what to expect... and my mind is blown. I really appreciate all of your support.
The final numbers...
