updates.update_content:
I'm not sure what to say, except thank you.
And the work's just begun.
I meet with the team this week, and then the next, to chart the course for the year.
This includes shoots already prepped for the next couple of weeks.

Good morning! With about 24 hours left in the campaign, I wanted to check-in and let you know where team SOLDIER is at. Well, we shot Saturday (full crew) and Sunday (running solo), and the results were simply extraordinary. It took me 6 hours to triple back up all the 4K footage from Saturday alone, which I do as soon as I get home, because I am a. methodical and b. insane. Folks, it was glorious... and we have over 2 TB of footage at the ready, and the Kickstarter hasn't even wrapped yet!
Thank you so much for supporting this project. I'm meeting with Daniel later this week to chart the course for the entire rest of the year. This now includes trips that wouldn't have been possible without your help. I can't wait for this post-Kickstarter phase to begin.

Happy Sunday!
Coming up on two weeks left in the campaign and we're still going strong. Thank you once again for joining me on this adventure. I wanted to let you know what I've been up to since we last talked... and I wanted to answer some questions I've been getting as well.
First off, I was a guest on a cool podcast and talked pretty extensively about SOLDIER. I'm usually not one to talk about process - I tend to let my 20 years of doc work speak for itself - but the questions were insightful and I was happy to chat with the two incredible hosts. Give it a listen here:

First, let's celebrate the fact that SOLDIER has met its goal. THANK YOU. I could not be here without every single one of you. Backer #115 wanted to make sure we had our minimum goal met so we could keep building on something great here, together. Basically: more shoots, more post work, more fests. And in the name of our friends at www.4WardProject.com, she's done just that. 
Second, please keep spreading the word. As technologically savvy as I may be, I'm not on Twitter, Instagram or TikTok. So, if you have a presence on any of these platforms, let the world know that is live, and funded, and worth checking out!

Hello, everyone. The support SOLDIER recieved on day 1 was inspiring. I was truly overwhelmed by the number of personal notes. I've been told that SEPTIC alone will be used by individuals in the field for years to come. If SOLDIER doesn't reach its goal - and I sure hope it does - we've already helped create real change. It's an amazing thought.

I've been asked by many folks if they should hold off on their contribution until later in the campaign. Please don't. I'd rather have a little now than a lot later. And remember, no one is charged until the campaign reaches the end - April 13th - and even then, only if it meets its goal. You can always change your amount down the road. What's important is that we have backers now, even for $1. Every. Single. Backer. Counts. Just like in real life. Keep spreading the word!

campaign.story:
Welcome Back to the House of Fear!
We're back with our 7th issue of House of Fear, and our 5th Kickstarter campaign!
House of Fear blends everything you love about Goosebumps, Scooby-Doo, and Tales From the Crypt. Each issue features complete, stand-alone stories that are always exciting, sometimes humorous, and occasionally downright scary.
(Okay,  it's not that scary. There are no nightmares here. But we've learned that young readers love the idea of reading comics their parents think are too scary for them.) 
We're using this Kickstarter campaign to raise funds to print the 33-page issue, House of Fear: Rubber & Glue, and hopefully, we'll hit a couple of Stretch Goals along the way for some additional items. 
What's it About?
Our first story, "Rubber & Glue," introduces us to a couple of students from Savini Middle School.
Caden and Isaac aren't exactly friends. 
And everything is most certainly not okay here. 
Caden thinks he has the upper hand, as always. But this time, he's in for a shock. Isaac isn't just repeating a childish retort...
...but instead is casting a curse. One that will force Caden to live a day in the life of the bullied. 
This story isn't the Monster-of-the-Month fare you've come to expect from House of Fear, but instead, examines the roles we play in middle school, and shines light on just how easy a harmless prank becomes something worse. It's as if Stephen King wrote an after-school special. 
This issue also features a backup story, "The Trees Have Eyes." This one starts peacefully enough, with Tosh and his dad out for a pleasant hike in the woods. 
Well, maybe not so peaceful or pleasant for Dad. And when they venture off the trail...
...and into a copse of aspen trees, things take a turn for the worse.
Trust me, you'll never look at Aspen trees the same again. 
What to Expect
Here's what you can expect when you back our latest campaign:
One issue featuring two complete, stand-alone stories.
33 pages of full-color thrills.
Fun, exciting comics suitable for (almost) all ages.
Bagged/boarded comics shipped in sturdy packaging.
We print House of Fear domestically, which means a faster turn around time (within 2 months of the campaign end).  
We're now printing on a heavy 70 lb paper stock with a 100 lb cover stock.  A heavier stock means the comics stand up to multiple reads and make the book more suitable for sharing. 
Stretch and Milestone Goals
We recently had our 175th backer, which means every backer gets a set of print-at-home activity pages. This set includes prompts for kids to draw their own monsters and comics, and of course, also includes coloring pages. 
If we reach 200 backers, all backers will receive a PDF of the B&W version of The Trees Have Eyes. See Jethro's line work in all its glory in this special version of the story. 
If we reach 225 backers, I'll upgrade the Digital Deluxe PDF to a full, behind-the-scenes, making of book. I received lots of feedback after our last campaign for this style of book, and I'm excited for the opportunity to do it again for Rubber & Glue.
Our First Kickstarter Exclusive Variant
We're big fans of the old EC comics, so for this campaign, we created our first variant cover as an homage to those horror comics from the 50s. Those are James Hislope's lines, and Josh Jensen's colors, with Matt Krotzer on letters and design. They absolutely nailed it, didn't they?
As a way to reward backers with a piece of House of Fear history, the variant is an exclusive to Kickstarter. We'll print to order (with an overage of 10% to cover possible damage during transit), so don't expect too many of these to make it to my online shop or to convention tables. 
The Rare, Serialized Variant
We've also got a rare variant for this campaign. This one features art by Jethro Morales and colors by Josh Jensen. There will be no House of Fear trade dress on the cover. Just the frightful artwork. 
Each copy will be individually serialized to only 31 copies. 
Boyle Minifig
We've partnered with Justin at Saber-Scorpion to produce a limited-edition Boyle minifig. The look and accessories are specific to this issue and will only be made available during this campaign. 
The image below is a prototype of what you can expect.
Exclusive, Crossover Print
Our first House of Fear crossover is here! Anyone who backs a physical reward for this campaign and the one for Phil Falco's Haunting 1-3 will receive this exclusive print, signed by the writers on both books. (Digital backers who back both will receive a digital version of the art.)
Stunning art by Jethro Morales and Josh Jensen
Haunting is a solid, supernatural horror comic for teens and adults. So if you have older kids in your house or if you like to sample new horror for yourself, now's the time to try something new!  
 The Rewards 
Add Ons
If you've backed a print tier, you can add additional print copies of House of Fear: Rubber & Glue. You can also catch up on all of the House of Fear comics with the Digital Catch Up add on. We have stickers, too!
After you select a tier to back, Kickstarter will take you to the Add-On page. If you see another issue you'd like to have, simple select it from the Add-On page. 
Other print issues of House of Fear will be available as add-on options after the campaign has ended.
Preview Pages
Below are pages from House of Fear: Rubber & Glue.
Shipping and Delivery
Our young readers aren't overly concerned with mint comics. All they care about is reading the story....and rereading it as many times as possible. 
But there are a lot of collectors reading House of Fear, too. We know true horror is getting a Kickstarter package in the mail and finding a crumpled comic inside.
With that in mind, we pack our books with the same care we used in making the book and the love that we have for our backers.
All comics come bagged and boarded. 
Any order that consists of 1 or 2 comics will be shipped in a sturdy, oversize envelope (stay flat mailers from Pratt Plus). 
All orders of 3 or more comics will be shipped in a Gemini Mailer for added protection. 
All packages will be sent via USPS Media Mail, First Class, or Priority Mail, depending on weight.
Timeline and Budget
The comic is 100% complete, so all we need to do is send the issue and sticker sheet to the printers. After 2-3 weeks, I'll start shipping everything to backers. 
But where do the funds go?
About half of the funds we earn through Kickstarter will be used to print the comic and other rewards. Shipping will take approximately 40% of the funds we receive, and 10% goes to Kickstarter for hosting the campaign.
Any extra money we earn from the campaign will help pay for future issues of House of Fear.
 Meet the Creators 
Will You Help Us Make Comics for Kids?
It's simple: We love making fun, exciting comics, and we want to get them to as many readers as I possibly can. We can't do that without support from readers like you.
Thank you for checking out our latest project. We hope you find a reward that suits you well, and when you do, that you back the campaign and help us continue making exciting, action-packed comics for kids.
Thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my FIFTH Kickstarter campaign! The comic is already complete, and all we have left to do is print the comic and other rewards. 

We're big fans of the Kickstarter platform, and we know how important it is for backers to get their rewards in a timely manner. So we plan to do everything we can to meet your expectations. Of course, if anything comes up that throws us off schedule, we will keep Kickstarter backers updated.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
A few quick updates on House of Fear: Rubber & Glue:
I sent surveys on Friday, and over 150 backers have responded already!
If you want your name on the Thank You page of the PDF, please respond by April 18. 
The stickers are already printed and in hand. 
Justin is finishing up the Boyle minifigs and they'll be here early next week.
The comics are being printed this week, and in hand next week.

Our House of Fear campaign might have ended, but there's still time to get in on the exclusive crossover print we have with Phil Falco's Haunting. (Not much time, though...there's only 2 days remaining.)

Kickstarter is still dealing with the finances from the campaign, but I haven't let that slow me down. This week I've:
Submitted my information to the printer to get rolling on comic printing
Sent the final files for printing the stickers
Paid Justin so he could start creating those magnificent Bolye minifigs 
Secured more bags and boards for shipping

Thank you again for supporting House of Fear. We're excited for you to check out the latest issue. 
So what's next?
1. Those backers whose pledges failed have five days to fix their pledges. There are 5-6 backers whose credit cards failed. If that's you, please take a moment to update your credit card information on Kickstarter.

We did it! Our latest issue of House of Fear has officially been funded on Kickstarter!
And by we, I truly mean you, me, the creators on the issue, and everyone who backed the campaign. Thank you so much for having faith in us and in the House of Fear series. I'm so grateful for the Kickstarter and comic community. 
Up next for me, well, I just want to relax, smile, and feel the love. I'll hop back on in a few days with information about what's next.

updates.update_userinfo: One backer from the 2nd most backed HoF campaign!
updates.update_content:
We only have about 24 hours left, but if we get one more backer, we'll have made this House of Fear campaign our second most backed campaign to date. 
I know, we don't celebrate being second best that often, right? 
But for me, right now, it's a big deal. I took a year off from all things creative and all things online, so I feel like I'm starting over these last few months. And to get back to those loftier numbers again absolutely makes this feel like the right thing to be doing.

THANK YOU!
We are blown away by the support from everyone who backed this campaign. We are planning to deliver this tale to you within 30 days. Please visit HeroTomorrow.com and facebook.com/herotomorrow for the latest news. All four issues of Bloom are expected to be released in 2021, and they will all be available through Kickstarter. {>_<}
— Ted Sikora    twitter.com/tedsikora   instagram.com/tedsikora
 [Final Day Stretch Goal UNLOCKED! - Photocover E will now feature a flipped back cover image, and Alicia Lynn will sign both front and back.]
[Bloom's unlocked stretch & milestone rewards: ALL BACKERS $5 & higher will receive $35 worth of additional digital rewards! Details below. ]
 This week's cover story in Comic Shop News! 
 The year is 1969. Ramsey is an aspiring comic book artist who is trying to find inspiration for his femme fatale. When he meets wild dancer, Regina, at a street fair he invites her into the woods for a character photoshoot where she begins to break on through to the other side. Witness the psycho-delic origin of the most powerful character in the Hero Tomorrow Comics universe. Issue 1 of a mind-bending 4 issue journey to reshape your reality!
Double sized first issue with 48 pages (40 story pages) full color, glossy paper.
All physical orders will include a signed print by Ted Sikora.
Page production is complete - Shipping in Late March 2021.
Survey will give you option to have them signed for FREE.
 Exclusive Cover variants only available through this campaign.
All four issues of this series will come out in 2021.

Ted Sikora (writer/creator/colorist/letterer) is a Cleveland/Akron based comic book writer and filmmaker. He is the president of Hero Tomorrow Comics, and the creator/writer/letterer of Tap Dance Killer andPunchline & the Vaude-Villains, and creator/co-writer/colorist/letterer of Apama The Undiscovered Animal. As a filmmaker he directed the indie feature Hero Tomorrow and hundreds of shorts in realms of documentary, music videos, and education. He wrote the libretto, principle music and lyrics for the horror show musical Nothing Like Vaudeville. 
Butch Mapa (artist) is a professional illustrator and graphic novelist with a decade of experience, currently illustrating Marvel's Action Avengers through IDW, He's done work for Zenescope, Top Shelf, Image, Upper Deck, and many others.  
Why Crowdfunding?
First, there's nothing better than having a direct connection to readers. I'm honored to have had that experience through conventions and Kickstarter over the past decade. Some of the most touching moments in my life have come from people telling me they see themselves in a character that I created. Also the interaction online with you helps shape these campaigns. It undoubtedly makes me a better creator, which hopefully  enhances the experience for you with each go 'round.
Secondly, BLOOM was actually solicited in the Previews Guide catalog in April of 2020, but due to the massive covid shutdown, that particular catalog was barely distributed. We had to pull it because it would have had no chance. Our business model relies heavily on comic conventions, and without cons we would simply lose money on every release. The Kickstarter platform is like a virtual comic con, and we can do things on it we can't even do at conventions. (like pick your shirt color and CGCs.)
As the industry changes we're trying to change with it.  I heartily thank you for supporting the indies and making this moment possible.

Thank you so much for checking out our campaign. 
Ted Sikora

campaign.story:
new for our final week!
Planet Comics is back for a second issue!
Issue #2 regular cover by Adrián "Bago" Gonzalez
 Planet Comics #2 is a new, 40+ page, full-color, oversized comic anthology that pays homage to the original 1940s pulp magazine!
Issue #2 Kickstarter exclusive cover by Andrés Muños Setz
Hi everyone! My name's Jeff McClelland, and I write books like The Tick and the Kickstarter-funded Black Terror: Social Insecurity. In 2020, I funded the just-shipped Planet Comics #1 right here on Kickstarter. That was such a blast that we're here to do it again with the all-new Planet Comics #2!
Planet Comics pays homage to the original 1940-'53 title from Fiction House, which featured futuristic stories of daring heroics with a mid-century design. This new series is presented in an oversized, magazine format, with lots of room for high adventure!
The book
Some talented friends and I have gathered back together to share some new stories with you. Issue #1 led off with "The Bulwark" from Andrea Schiavone and myself, and we continue this story in our second issue! Here's a preview of the new story:
The Bulwark preview
The Bulwark preview
In this issue: an original Grumble story!
This issue also features a very special original "Grumble" story from the entire crew - Rafer Roberts, Mike Norton, Marissa Louse and Crank! This story is all new and has never been published anywhere else!  
Grumble preview
 Continuing from issue #1 is "The Old Man and The Sea of Love" by Jeff McComsey!
The Old Man and The Sea of Love preview
And debuting this issue is a story about the coolest dog you've ever met, "Badges O'Keefe, Canine Time Thief" with Dani Grew and Larry Franks!
Badges O'Keefe preview
This issue also features another in-depth article by Diana Krueger on the life of Matt Baker, Golden Age artist and designer, plus a few more items that I hope to add if we get past our initial goal!
Rewards
The biggest reward for this campaign is, of course, the book itself. Whether you go in for the physical copy or digital, I hope you'll feel that your pledge is well spent on these new sci-fi tales.
This issue comes with two covers: a regular cover with art by Adrián "Bago" Gonzalez, and a Kickstarter-exclusive variant cover by Andrés Muños Setz! You can order just the regular cover, or both at the same time.
In addition, everyone who pledges at the $8 level or above will get a copy of an electronic "making of" publication, with a behind-the-scenes look a the creation of this issue. You'll also get your name printed in a "thank you" section in the book, and you'll get a digital copy an original Planet Comics issue from the 1940s!
There are some other, limited, physical rewards that you can get from this campaign. Here are a few!
There'll be a short run of hand-screened shirts that'll look something like this:
accessorize!
 There are also some acrylic pins to be had!
it's a pin!
You can also stock up on some other book that I've been involved with!
Get a bunch of comics!
There's a limited crochet alien reward that goes well with the last campaign's rocket ship!
I mean, look at this guy.
Bulwark artist Andrea Schiavone is drawing a limited number of social media profile images as a special, limited reward! They'll look something like this:
look just as fashionable!
And if you've ever wanted to see your furry pal in a comic book, this is your chance! Artist Dani Grew will draw your dog in the "Badges O'Keefe" story if you choose this very limited reward!
*Also! The first 30 backers - at any physical level - will receive this Planet Comics fridge magnet with your order at no additional charge!*
stick it on your fridge!
The campaign goal
My first goal with this campaign is to be able to pay the creators a decent rate for their work. After that, I hope to offset some of the printing and shipping costs that otherwise might be prohibitive. 
If this campaign exceeds its initial goal, all of those extra funds will be funneled directly back into the book, adding pages and helping us get started with issue #3!
Follow me online!
If you're looking for more content, progress reports or just to see pictures of my dog, you can always follow me online by clicking the images below:

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
I wanted to send out a quick note to thank you all for supporting the project! We reached our goal on the 28th and LET ME TELL YOU – it was a good feeling. I’m excited to bring this book to all of you. Like I’ve said from the beginning, it’s my hope to publish at least four issues of the book, so I’m working on not just this second issue, but ones further down the line, as well.
What’s next?

Hello everyone,
There are only a few hours left in the campaign, but I've gotten a couple questions yesterday and today about add-ons and I'd like to address them while there's still (a little) time.
Add-ons are a great option for Kickstarter, and they would've prevented me from creating the vast number of different reward combinations that I did this time around, but they've only been available for a few weeks - they were still in the testing phase when I launched this particular campaign. So we're kind of running at half-steam, with a few add-ons available (like pins), but not for some of the more limited rewards, since I can't edit reward options after they have backers.

Hello once again, everyone!
We're nearing the end of our campaign, and I can't thank each and every one of you enough for all the support you've shown this project. We still have a little further to go to reach the goal, but I do believe that it's possible. I'm really excited to see this move forward! I appreciate your help in getting the word out.

Hello everyone!
Thank so much for your support of this project! With three weeks to go, we’re over $2000 and are about 70% to our goal! Things have slowed down a bit this week, and I’m curious – does anyone think that five weeks is too long for a campaign? Should I have shortened the length at all? If this campaign goes well, I’m hoping to come back with a third issue, so I’m asking for your advice for the future. If we do an issue three, should I run a shorter campaign? If you have an opinion, I hope you’ll let me know!

updates.update_userinfo: We're off to a great start!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
I want to welcome all of you to this new Planet Comics campaign! I’m happy to see that a number of you from the first campaign have navigated your way over here for the second issue – that’s wonderful!
What’s also wonderful is that in just two days, we’re already almost halfway to our overall goal! There’s still work to be done but I’m cautiously optimistic that we’ll get to where we want to go.

campaign.story:
A new 120-page original graphic novel from The Pride & Glitter Vipers writer Joe Glass, Elk Mountain's Vince Underwood, Vagrant Queen's Harry Saxon & Eisner Award-winning editor and letterer Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou about superhero refugees, and deep family secrets.

The Miracles is a brand new, 120 page original graphic novel. It tells the story of high school senior Elliot Morgan: a massive comic fan with graduation and Major Voltage Adventures on his mind, when he's astonished to discover he has superhuman abilities of his own. 
When he almost immediately goes out and makes a public display of his new superheroic abilities, he's amazed to be confronted by his favourite comic book characters staring him down in the real world. As if that wasn't crazy enough, they reveal the truth about themselves - they're his parents and they reveal that they are refugees from the world of his favourite comic book escaped to this world when he was just a baby. 
What follows is revelation after revelation, after more and more of the family's secrets come to light. Just how many secrets can one family be keeping?
The Miracle Family by Luciano Vecchio
Elliot Morgan aka Miracle design by Vince Underwood
Elliot Morgan a.k.a. Miracle - Elliot is an average teen boy, and a bit of a geek. He’s an outward optimist but harbours within him some anger. Elliot's anger seems to revolve around the idea that so much about himself was kept secret from him, but there's more that he's keeping inside himself. He is a believer in taking a responsibility for his home with his new capabilities, and with those newfound reality-warping abilities, there's little that he can't do.
Ayden Morgan a.k.a. Empath design by Vince Underwood
Ayden Morgan a.k.a. Empath - Elliot’s younger in age but bigger in size brother, Ayden is much more quiet, introverted and sullen than Elliot. Ayden has been dealing with intense mental health issues, that may be connected to his empathic abilities, and he has to learn to come to terms and learn to live with them.
Evan Morgan a.k.a. Major Voltage design by Vince Underwood
Evan Morgan a.k.a. Major Voltage - Elliot’s father, Evan was his world’s leading superhero. Proud, tough, but with a warm, open heart, he’s always been troubled by the fact he and his wife kept their kids’ true nature from them. Defending his family has been his sole purpose since taking refuge in this world, so he now has a less ostentatious profession than 'superhero' to help stay hidden. However, he holds some pride in his son taking up his old line of work.
Kate Morgan a.k.a. Ms Phantom design by Vince Underwood
Kate Morgan a.k.a. Ms. Phantom - Kate is Elliot and Ayden’s mother, and is the one responsible for hiding their true natures from them using her telepathy. She’s almost the opposite of Evan in that she’s quieter, seems sadder, and the escape to their new home and what it led to took its toll. However, she is fiercely protective of her family, and would go to any length for them.
Jessica Lectron a.k.a. Superia design by Vince Underwood
Jessica Morgan a.k.a. Superia - Elliot’s cousin, Evan’s niece, Superia was another great hero of their home reality. She was bright, bushy tailed and brash, but in the ‘real’ world has become more serious, grimmer and reserved. Much of this comes from the trauma of the move over to the new world, and she has withdrawn from the main family significantly, implying there might be more to her pull away from both the family and from her previous life as a superhero than is known.
Elliot Morgan is your average teenage outcast, keeping his head down as best he can to get through High School. One thing that's been a source of comfort to him all his life has been his love of comic books, particularly one comic book: the mysterious final issue of Major Voltage Adventures. An issue written by a reclusive British comics writer, that sees the heroes in a tense stand-off with their arch-nemesis Maestro during a reality-shattering Catastrophe. The story is left unresolved and is a major topic of debate and theorising for decades. Elliot doesn't know why he's so obsessed with it, but it's the one comic he comes back to read again and again. 
Then one day, the strangest thing happens: Elliot starts exhibiting unnatural, superhuman abilities. From there, Elliot's world is turned upside down, with revelation after revelation, not least of which being his parents are Major Voltage and Ms Phantom, and his family came to this world from the fictional world of his favourite comic book. 
Superia designs by Andrew Sebastien Kwan
Now deciding to use his great gifts for good in the 'real' world, just how will that work for a superhuman refugee from a comic book? And what other skeletons are the Morgans keeping in their closet?
We're going for a mix of soap opera drama and large scale superhero action adventure. Think The OC crossed with The Incredibles. Fantastic Four mixed with 13 Reasons Why. This Is Us meets X-Men, by way of Invincible. 
Empath/Ayden design by Zoe Thorogood
The Miracles is a story I've been working on and wanting to tell since I started writing The Pride. The Miracles has been a comic series, a book, a mini-series, and over the years I've worked with numerous artists to develop the idea including Gavin Mitchell, Kris Anka, Zoe Thorogood and Andrew Sebastian Kwan. Now, having found the perfect team to finally make this project a reality, we'll bring it out as an Original Graphic Novel so everyone can finally have this tale of families, broken realities and the secrets we keep. While we touch on a number of issues including refugees, the role of a hero in the world, personal responsibility to one's home, whether born there or found, the main core remains family and secrets. 
Original Character Designs/Sketch by Kris Anka
Joe Glass - Writer
JOE GLASS - Writer - Joe is the writer and creator of LGBTQ+ superhero team series, The Pride. Originally self-published, The Pride was the first ComiXology Submit title that got upgraded and continued as a ComiXology Originals series. He's also released superhero political thriller Acceptable Losses and glitter noir, queer grindhouse revenge fantasy, Glitter Vipers. A staunch advocate for inclusion and representation in comics, Joe does whatever he can to make that happen. Joe lives in South Wales, UK with a belligerent cat named Oliver. You can follow him on twitter and YouTube. 

Vince Underwood - Artist
VINCE UNDERWOOD - Artist - Vince is an American comic book artist. His credits include Elk Mountain and Page Turn (both available on Comixology). He has also done comics work for transmedia horror company Cold Room Entertainment and illustrated for NBC Sports and the San Francisco Giants. Vince lives with and by the grace of his wonderful wife Hannah, their two dogs Cassie and Millie, and their cat Derek. You can follow him on twitter. 

HARRY SAXON - Colours - Harry is an illustrator and comics colourist from Greece. He is currently 38 years old and irreversibly trans. You might know his work from titles such as Vault Comics’ Vagrant Queen and its successor Vagrant Queen: A Planet Called Doom and Test and Black Mask’s Sex Death Revolution. If you don’t know his work, this is an excellent way of getting started. You can check his website and follow him on twitter. Friendship and discounts offered if you’re into Doctor Who.
HASSAN OTSMANE-ELHAOU - Letters - Hassan is a British/Algerian letterer of comics. He's worked on things like Quantum & Woody, Undone by Blood and First Knife. He's also the voice behind Strip Panel Naked, and the editor of the Eisner-winning PanelxPanel magazine. You can follow him on twitter and YouTube. 

We'll also have a cover by amazing artist, the fabulous Kevin Wada, and the logo has been designed by the incomparable Dominic Xavier Crewe.
Cover Artwork by Kevin Wada
The book is still being made as we speak and raise funds, and we are planning/expecting to have it ready for release and posting to backers for the third quarter of 2021, looking at October 2021. We're about 10% complete as of now, and are on schedule to hit this goal. 
We want as many people as possible to be able to get and read The Miracles. As such, we are keeping a cheaper digital option available for those on a budget who still want to read our action-packed, amazing superhero family story. 
Mock-up for the Kickstarter Exclusive Hardcover edition

This is a BIG project, possibly one of the biggest I've ever done, and so we need all the help we can get to cover this. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be my third campaign run during the pandemic, as well as my ninth campaign overall, so by now I have a lot of experience with running these things. 

That being said, postage/shipping is something that can often catch people out, myself included in the past. So, for this campaign, being my biggest campaign to date, I've partnered with a fulfilment company to handle the US backers, which will also mean we can keep the price down for those international backers that are the most expensive to ship from the UK too. 

Life factors can sometimes delay production, even in the midst of lockdowns and the like. I've done my best to factor those in, but as always, some things can never really be planned for. However, if and when anything like that happens that will cause a delay in production or delivering rewards, me and the team will communicate that to you right away. 

Ultimately, barring any huge, sweeping changes to postage costs or with the pandemic situation itself, this will all be handled on time and with professionalism.

campaign.story:
Where were you in the 1980s? Were you into college radio? Were you even born? Were you a college DJ, or a student station manager? Experience the era that ignited a new music revolution thanks to the blood, spit, and bravado of college radio. Post-Punk! Synth Pop! New Wave! & Indie/Alternative get the 4-color comic book treatment in HEAVY ROTATION, a love letter to '80s college radio.
POWER. CORRUPTION. COLLEGE RADIO!
In the mid ‘80s, a group of reckless teenagers converged on an upstate New York college town to study the fine art of Communications. These shy social misfits & miscreants became DJs at the perfect moment in college radio history: when album-oriented Top 40 rock was kicked to the curb. 
cover art & logo by Philip Bond (not final)
 Armed with neon rubber bracelets, exploding tubes of black eyeliner, and big hair, this cadre of culture vultures ushered in “New Music,” a combination of punk, new wave, new romantic, goth, and indie/alternative. They played the hell out of Adam and the Ants, Violent Femmes, The Clash, The Smiths, New Order, and The Cure. Their lives -- and the upstate NY college town of Ithaca -- were forever changed.  
DJs Heather, Brother Mike (animated), Glenn and Barbra circa 1985.
30+ years later these college DJs (still music-obsessed but, strangely, not much older) have reconvened to celebrate '80s college radio in HEAVY ROTATION, a 48-page anthology of short comics, prose & single illustrations, essays and interviews with an impressive lineup of comic book artists.
Page 1 of a 5-page short story written by Shelly Bond and illustrated by Mark Stafford.
You'll find out the answers to these burning questions and more:  
+ What’s up with the ancient analog tech like reel-to-reel machines and promo carts?
+ What is the FCC and how did it impact our fun on college radio?
+ What's the perfect segue?
+ Why do audio majors run around campus with razor blades?
+ What is this "dot" rotation system and who determined these maddening rules?
+ Does "Dead Air" actually kill you?
+ What does a college DJ actually do?
+ How did we find out about cool new bands – and old ones who had a huge catalog that was an undiscovered planet waiting to be explored?

A lot of the time, the answer was college radio.
92 WICB ITHACA, THE STATION FOR INNOVATION
It was, and is, the FCC licensed radio station operated by students from Ithaca College, broadcasting 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
DJ Mike Sauter and an illustration of Brother Mike Cohen by Rodd Perry.
Prose story in progress written by Barbra Baker with illustrations by A.D. Puchalski.
It was indeed an aural adventure to have access to a local college radio station, where you could hear British punk & new wave, '70s era Bowie, Kate Bush, Heaven 17, and local bands you couldn’t see live if you were underage.
But even better: being a DJ on a college radio station during the golden era of college radio--when indie was truly indie and before “alternative” was a cash cow.
College DJ Glenn Raucher showing off a favorite album on his specialty show, The Musical Box.
’There was something reassuring about placing a needle on a record," says college DJ Glenn Raucher. "And, if you did your job right, hearing sound, even with the pops, clicks, and hisses that it often entailed."

THE REWARDS
THE COMIC BOOK
Chock-full of short comics, single illustration and prose, essays, and other illuminating tales, this anthology comic is 48 full-color pages.
Available digitally and in print.

THE SWAG BAG
2 pin badges! 2 postcards! 2 vinyl stickers! 
Artwork not final.
THE BREAKDOWN
If we go beyond our modest target goal, we'll be able to add and unlock stretch goals and hopefully pay our contributors what they're worth.
Here's how the funds will be allocated:
Where the money goes...
THE FADE OUT
HEAVY ROTATION is a 48-page love letter to '80s college radio, collecting the shared experiences of a group of people who grew up together left of the dial — and are still connected three decades later. It will appeal to anyone whose favorite band eluded the mainstream, anyone who loved the ’80s, and everyone who loves someone who loved the ‘80s.

Spearheaded by veteran DC/Vertigo and Black Crown comic book editor and former college DJ Shelly Bond, HEAVY ROTATION is brought to you by former WICB DJs/current professional writers, DJs, tech ops directors, teachers, home schoolers, and an all-star lineup of artists including Philip Bond (Kill Your Boyfriend, Eve Stranger), Michael Allred (Bowie: Stardust, Rayguns & Moonage Daydreams, Silver Surfer), Kitty Curran (Taylor Swift: Girl Detective), A.D. Puchalski (Insider Art),  Mark Stafford (Lip Hook), and Rachael Smith (Quarantine Comix), who are connected by one thing: 
A mutual admiration for cool music and the power, corruption and glory of being an FCC-license toting college DJ.
Page 2 work-in-progress of "Seventh Dream of Heavy Rotation" by Shelly Bond & Mark Stafford.
"I've spent my life caught in a tumultuous war between my love for comics and music," said editor Shelly Bond, "Which is why my indie work often combines the two. I hope you'll join us in creating this 4-color sequential portal back to the mid ‘80s, when the only music that mattered was the music we played on our radio shifts."
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Assembling a comic during COVID isn’t difficult if you know how it’s done. Last summer, Bond created INSIDER ART with 150 female and NB editors, writers, and artists from around the globe from March through May, and funded the 272-page comics compendium in 15 days. The files were sent to the printer in September and the 1200 copy print run of the softcover was delivered by the end of 2020. 

Bond’s first two Kickstarters, the Eisner Award-nominated FEMME MAGNIFIQUE: 50 Magnificent Women Who Changed the World and HEY, AMATEUR!, brought great joy to over 2000 readers. While HEAVY ROTATION is on a smaller scale, it contains all the vim and artistic panache that readers have come to expect from Bond’s work. And more acknowledgement to cool music! 

Many stories have been commissioned and 3 are completely finished. Unless there are significant delays with the USPS and printer, the comic book and signature swag bag rewards will be sent to each backer by May 2021. As with all of Bond's campaigns, full disclosure and frequent art and photo updates are part of the crowdfunding experience.

Everyone!
HEAVY ROTATION is headed in your direction very soon. I just received the printer proof and gave it a 5-star rating! The comics are scheduled to land in Los Angeles on June 16th, and I'll do my best to get them packed up with boards and bags and mailed out by the end of June, early July. Hello, HEAVY ROT Backers!
Had a productive week and thought I'd share:
Our comic book is ATP: At The Printer! 
When I confirmed the turnaround time, I was told there are continued delays due to Covid-19. The comics travel by boat from Korea to the printer's entry port in Los Angeles. While we still hope for delivery into my arms by the end of May,  it might be early June.  Apologies about that and in the spirit of full disclosure, here's the article my printer shared so you know it's legit:

Happy Monday!
Everything is 99.2% final. 
But first things first: 
Another 9-panel ART BLAST!

Hello, HEAVY ROTATION enthusiasts!
I hope this update finds you safe/well/enjoying a solid soundtrack.
Mid-March status is strong.
By the Numbers:

Hooray! We did it!
I’m listening to the HEAVY ROT CELEBRATION mix while I type, so I highly recommend cranking it up or pulling out your headphones while you read this loquacious thank-you note. playloud
Massive thanks to you, our 845 generous backers, from 20+ former DJs and various HR/HQ friends & family. Bloody hell! We've raised $16,484! For the record, when I set the original 3K target goal, it was the absolute bare minimum, and included paying the artists far less than what they deserved. With your help, we've been able to crush 4 stretch goals, add amazing extras, and now we can pay the contributors more reasonably.

Wow! Just woke up to find that we raised over 16K! That’s massive! I was up most of the night, so as soon as I get some solid caffeine, I’ll be back to write a proper follow-up.
But major thanks for helping a group of ‘80s post-punk college radio DJs create what we know is going to be an epic, sequential adventure for all of us.
Viva Comics & College Radio!

Okay call me crazy, but we have 9 hours of funding left so it’s time for an 11th hour final stretch goal:
If we hit 18K we can add another 8 pages!
That’s a 64-page comic book anthology chock-full of sound & vision!
Plus all the FREE stretch goal extras when you back at $8 bucks & up: the PDF, the bumper sticker, the 5x7 Allred Starman/Bowie print, the 3.5 x 5.5 notebook for “record keeping” & 8 more supersonic story & art pages!

Heavy Rotation Backers!
Hard to believe we’ve got less than 33 hours to wrap up the campaign. Thank you so much for being a part of the process. It’s been exhilarating/exhausting and I wouldn’t have it any other way.
Kickstarter is amazing platform because of its community, both in the ability to reach a discerning, like-minded readership, and to create a positive environment for creators. Sometimes I'll see art students Kickstarting their first anthology and back them because they have style and verve; often I’ll see an old colleague and I’ll back their project because I couldn’t buy them a drink in 2020.  And then there are the artists, writers and editors I discover while I’m hustling like a deranged politician, keeping track of the stretch goals, designing graphics, and bossing my amazing curatorial partners, Barbra and Heather, around.

I worked at WREK in Atlanta in college, then came back as an alumnus in the early 2000s to help them get their digital automation set up. The funny thing is that the pictures of our station in the 80s look exactly like your photos.

One of the few things I miss about that period of my life is being in a packed broadcast booth on a Friday night with all of my friends, connecting with listeners over 500 watts as the only English-language radio station within a 90 mile radius.
Madness, The Specials, The Smiths, FGTH, Kate Bush, Prince, Talking Heads, Eurythmics, Sade, Pet Shop Boys, U2, Bowie, Peter Gabriel, etc. The greatest of times
Gone are the days of the greatest ever DJ, John Peel discovering & promoting bands too many bands to list(how could I forget Happy Mondays & the Stone Roses?!)
London After Midnight FTW!

While I have no idea what it was like to have been a college radio deejay in the 80's, I do know what it was like to have been a college radio deejay in the 90's and I think this will bring back a lot of nostalgia for me of my time spent in the cockroach-infested dingy-basement studios of WRUW at Case Western Reserve University in Cleveland.
Jodi...IC Class of '96

I was a DJ at WRMC-FM, Middlebury College from 1989-1993--I met my best friends at that station and discovered music that changed my life. In 2008 I returned to campus to teach a January Term course (on comic books!) and I was fortunate to get a show at my old station for that month. I've also scratched my amateur DJ itch weekly at WVEW-LPFM, a community station in my town of Brattleboro, VT for the past 20 years (on hiatus since COVID, but I look forward to going back.) I'm absolutely delighted to see this comic come to life. Time to break out my 80s and early 90s indie and shoegaze records.

BTW, the highlight of the comics class I taught (History and Development of the Comic Book in the US, under the auspices of the Am Civ department) was a guest lecture from my friend Stephen Bissette (VT is a small place) up from the Center for Cartoon Studies to talk to the class about undergrounds.
-Mike
I'd love to add a Postcard to my PDF pledge - can we do this during pledge collection please?
How can I not support this? Screaming at you live from the home of Martha Quinn, WOSS 99.1 FM, we got a legacy to keep on keepin' on!
I did some college radio in the early 80s and all my friends were communications majors. This is something near and dear to my heart.
So very pleased, thrilled, to be part of this project!

campaign.story:
WE NEED BEEF BROS
In the beginning, superheroes were all about one thing: Protecting the little guy, gal, or nonbinary pal. But somewhere along the way that got lost, as capes transformed from populist defenders of the working class to glorified supercops. Enter BEEF BROS, a revolutionary, leftist take on superheroes by Aubrey Sitterson (No One Left to Fight, The Comic Book Story of Professional Wrestling) and Tyrell Cannon (Eris, Speculative Relationships).
BEEF BROS #1 is a self-contained 32-page, full-color issue, but like all the best superhero stories, it leaves the door wide open for future adventures! Check out our stretch goals below!  
Keep scrolling to check out our rewards, including stickers, Tyrell commissions, and even original art from BEEF BROS #1!
TELL ME MORE!
It’s a rare contemporary superhero comic that doesn’t feature somewhat…troubling politics. Most tend to be concerned not with creating a better world but merely defending the status quo, not to mention all the flat-out reactionary takes on the genre!
The solution? BEEF BROS, an eye-searing, gonzo comic about Huey and Ajax Beef, a pair of neighborhood heroes willing to brawl with sadistic police, cruel landlords, and predatory corporations not because of any complicated college-boy theorizing, but because helping people out is simply the right thing to do. 
Imagine Noam Chomsky’s Heroes for Hire meeting Peter Kropotkin’s Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure. It’s an anarcho-communist take on superheroes with politics so radical that the big corporate-owned publishers would never touch it. That’s why we need your help! Become a BEEFER today!
Tyrell commission
Tyrell commission
BEEF BROS original art
BEEF BROS original art
WHAT IF YOU RAISE MORE MONEY?
$25,000: Everybody gets raises
BEEF BROS is a project our entire team believes in, which is why we’re all doing it for bargain basement prices. Our writer, Aubrey, isn’t taking a page rate at all! If we hit our first stretch goal, that changes, with Tyrell, Fico and Taylor getting raises and Aubrey getting a page rate.
$35,000: BEEF BROS #2 
We have a deep, deep aching in our loins to do approximately a gajillion issues of BEEF BROS, and if we pull in enough cash on this campaign, we’ll be able to get a headstart on that by funding the creative costs of issue #2!
$45,000: Everybody gets raises
Same as before, if we make a whopping $45,000, the entire team gets their increased rate on BEEF BROS #2!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Tyrell has run four successful Kickstarter campaigns to date, delivering rewards safely and on time to backers. He has self-published more than 20 of his own comics, exhibited at many shows across the US, and is an organizer of the Chicago Alternative Comics Expo. This is, as they say, “not his first rodeo.” He knows the many challenges of putting a comic together and getting it into the hands of readers and will always meet those challenges with proper planning and communication.

Prior to becoming a comics writer, Aubrey worked as an editor at both Marvel Comics and Image Comics, providing him with insight and experience managing all aspects of comic book production. In addition, the rest of our team, Fico Ossio and Taylor Esposito, are seasoned professionals with sterling reputations for high-quality work delivered on time.

The COVID-19 pandemic has presented numerous challenges for the comics industry. However, we have already confirmed that our printer is operating at full capacity. We have also researched multiple shipping options in order to have back-up delivery plans in place. While more challenges could arise due to the current pandemic, we will always be communicative and upfront with our backers about the status of the project.

International backers: The COVID-19 pandemic has caused significant delays in international shipping and customs clearance. While we're happy to ship BEEF BROS #1 to you, please know that we cannot guarantee a time for its arrival.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Brothers, sisters, and gender resisters, allow me to get down to brass tacks: Chris Moreno and my Kickstarter for the anti-gentrification kung fu comic Stoned Master is six days from completion and we're still $2,000 shy of our goal.
I say this not to guilt or coerce you but, rather, for your benefit! The truth is, if you miss out on Stoned Master, you're going to regret it. Why? Because if you loved BEEF BROS, you're going to flip for StonedMaster.

updates.update_userinfo: Why BEEFERS should back Stoned Master. PLUS: A shipping update and a BEEFER photo gallery!
updates.update_content: Brothers, sisters, and gender resisters, I am pleased as punch to inform you that after a grueling ten-day sprint, I have successfully packed and mailed BEEF BROS to all BEEFERS! If you haven't received a tracking number via email, you might not have filled out your survey by the time I downloaded the backer report. But not to worry! I'm diving right back in to handle the remaining shipments. First, however…

updates.update_userinfo: BEEF BROS shipping now! Plus: STONED MASTER!
updates.update_content: Brothers, sisters, and gender resisters, WHAT. A. WEEK. As many of you are already aware, from shipping alerts, seeing BEEFERS post photos on social media, and actually getting it your hot little hands: BEEF BROS is currently shipping worldwide! And, as if that wasn't exciting enough, I have a brand-new Kickstarters launching today for Stoned Master! Details on BEEF BROS fulfillment progress, Stoned Master, Tyrell's latest book, my newest Dark Horse comic Savage Hearts, and Tales to Enlighten, another Kickstarter you should absolutely be supporting, down below!

updates.update_userinfo: THE BEEF BROS ARE ALMOST HERE!
updates.update_content: Brothers, sisters, and gender resisters, you have been so incredibly patient and I know exactly how difficult that is because – believe me when I say this – no one is more excited about BEEF BROS than the BEEF BROS team. Fortunately, it won't be much longer before you have the most bodacious superhero comic in this or any other galaxy in your hot little BEEFER hands! Right now we're putting the final touches on some production elements and then it's off the printer. Taylor already finished the letters; here's a sneak peek!

Brothers, sisters, and gender resisters, before I get into our update, please, if you haven't already, fill out your backer survey! We need your information to send out backer rewards!
Speaking of which, while we lost a bit of time due to COVID-19, we're now charging toward the finish line. If you get us your details, we should still be on track for our April delivery, or extremely close to it!
Ergo, please make any changes to your address by April 1, 2021. No fooling!

Brothers, sisters, and gender resisters! I'm back in your inboxes to give you, the BEEFERS, an update on the production of the biggest, brightest, beefiest superhero comic in all of space and time...BEEF BROS #1!
But first, and crucially, please fill out your backer survey so I can get you your copy of BEEF BROS as soon as possible. Even with Tyrell and his family triumphantly battling COVID-19 late last year, the entire team has kicked things into overdrive and we're looking good for our April delivery!

updates.update_userinfo: BEEF BROS thumbnails helped me gain 12.6 pounds of muscle!
updates.update_content:
Brothers, sisters, and gender resisters, we are back! Happy belated holidays and New Year and thank you for your patience as we work to make BEEF BROS #1 unlike any comic book you've ever read, the kind of comic book that BEEFERS deserve!
I've been trying to stay out of your hair but I just had to reach out because Brother Tyrell sent over his first batch of BEEF BROS thumbnails (BEEFNAILS?) and, after looking at them, I gained 12.6 pounds of lean muscle mass. But before I tell you this incredible tale…

It's appropriate that the BEEF BROS campaign is ending on Thanksgiving morning because I have so very much to be thankful for. I'm thankful for crushing our funding goal in our first five days; never was it in doubt that we'd get to make BEEF BROS #1. I'm thankful that we sailed right through our STRETCH GOAL, ensuring that everyone on the team can get a raise and I can get a page rate. But even more than the dollars raised, I'm thankful for another, far more important number: The amount of backers.
More than 1,500 people decided that they're tired of corporate-owned supercops; that they want superheroes who protect people from institutions, not the other way around; and that they were willing to put their money where their mouths were and BACK THE BEEF. Together, we're not only funding ethically and equitably produced superhero comics with politics we can be proud of, we're building something larger: the BEEF BROS MOVEMENT.

updates.update_userinfo: BEEF BROS Day 29: Only hours remain!
updates.update_content:
If you can't wait to get to the ENGAGEMENT, scroll down to the comments and answer me this question: What are you going to do with yourself between now and April while you wait for BEEF BROS #1!?
By any reasonable definition, we did it: BEEF BROS #1 was funded in only five days, we've built a movement of more than 1,300 BEEFERS, garnering mainstream attention and sustained buzz, and it's all because of you, your kindness, your generosity, your enthusiasm. It's because of the BEEF BROS ETHOS and the BEEF BROS MOVEMENT. But we're not done yet!

And above all, it’s kind! It’s just that. Just kind. If I run away today, good people will die. If I stand and fight, some of them might live. Maybe not many, maybe not for long. Hey, you know, maybe there’s no point to any of this at all. But it’s the best I can do. So I’m going to do it. And I will stand here doing it until it kills me. And you’re going to die too! campaign.story:
Wailing Blade is high-adrenaline fantasy adventure, set in the dark future of mankind.
 When his father is sentenced to death at the hands of the legendary Headtaker, bandit prince Tychon must find a way to save him, or fall to the Wailing Blade himself.
Plus, for the first time ever, you can get your hands on the... 
WAILING BLADE #1 - CREATOR'S EDITION 
And for the ULTIMATE COLLECTOR Ready to Take the Blade with both hands...
WAILING BLADE: HEADTAKER COLLECTOR'S BOX
Intrigued?
Let us tell you more about this extraordinary book!
SYNOPSES
Thousands of years after mankind’s fall from the stars, the remnants of humanity live under the brutal thumb of tyrannical rulers who wield futuristic technology that to the masses, is indistinguishable from magic.
These petty warlords squabble over the dwindling resources of a dying earth, while they themselves bow down to the Tyrant of Minturn, who crushes all who oppose him with his legendary executioners – warriors who wield the deadliest weapons from mankind’s starfaring days.
The most feared of these executioners is the Head Taker, who wields the mighty and unstoppable Wailing Blade – a sword which screams louder than the victims it beheads.
Each year, he travels the breadth of the Tyrant’s empire, dispensing justice and enforcing his will.
Standing against the Tyrant are scattered clans of bandits, like the Windcleavers.
Desperate scavengers, they defy the Tyrant by raiding his caravans, and keeping forbidden technology for themselves.
Their prince, Tychon, sees an opportunity to pluck a great prize from the Tyrant’s grasp, setting himself on a path that leads to a confrontation with death itself, and the WAILING BLADE!

Who will love Wailing Blade?
Fans of Conan, Elric, Masters of the Universe and other sword & sorcery epics.
People who like Mad Max, The Dying Earth, and other tales of dark futures.
Collectors of superior quality modern independent graphic novels from a world-class team of up-and-comers and industry veterans!
If you like your comics with tons of action, over-the-top weaponry, and mind-blowing visuals, THIS IS YOUR BOOK!
What Exactly Do You Get When You Take the Blade and Back This Campaign?
 Wailing Blade Volume 1: Headtaker is a 144-page collection in standard American comic size, on printed on high-quality paper.
 Wailing Blade Volume 1: Headtaker is available in three amazing options -- A super affordable direct market softcover edition, a ComixTribe-Exclusive "Virgin" Wrap-Around softcover trade, and a premium limited edition foil-enhanced, die-cut hardcover.
This volume collects the entire critically acclaimed mini-series originally released in the direct market in single issue format as WAILING BLADE #1-4. 
 Wailing Blade: Headtaker features a foreword written by Batman & The Outsiders and Titans writer Brian Edward Hill, who calls Wailing Blade "a beautiful, volatile reaction, a combination of medieval storytelling and visionary technology... a visionary ride that pulls you through its world." 
⚔️📜 PLUS: This Volume also includes an all-new LEGENDS OF THE WAILING BLADE collection of tavern-tales and yarns that reveal the origins of the legendary weapon, as told and illustrated by top creators in the world of indie comics! (STAY TUNED AS WE REVEAL CREATOR CONTRIBUTORS THROUGHOUT THIS CAMPAIGN!) 
 NEW COLLECTION EXCLUSIVE: This new volume contains a thrilling, never-before-published FINAL SCENE that was not included in the single issue release that fans of this series will not want to miss as it includes the first appearance of TWO more of the Tyrant's merciless EXECUTIONERS!
All backers will also receive loads of additional bonus content in the Tyrant's Cut Digital Deluxe PDF and the Wailing Blade Original Theme Heavy Metal Anthem MP3 by "Making Metal With" George O'Connor! 
 NEW! Wailing Blade #1 - CREATOR'S EDITION is an all-new, campaign exclusive printing of the smash-hit first issue, featuring a side-by-side look at acclaimed writer Rich Douek's script next to artist Joe Mulvey's immaculate black & white line art! This also includes the original Wailing Blade pitch greenlit by ComixTribe and bonus process sketches, making it a must have for writers, artists and comic book process junkies! Each book will be numbered and signed by Joe and I. (**SPECIAL ADD-ON ITEM! Can be added to ANY Pledge Level!**) 
Or take the blade to a whole new level when you get ALL FOUR NEW BOOKS plus a whole lot more in a limited edition WAILING BLADE: HEADTAKER Collector's Box! 
At highest levels, limited opportunities to get custom sketches, stories, signed materials, and the chance to be EXECUTED BY THE HEADTAKER YOURSELF! 
The Comics Industry Picked Up the Wailing Blade... and LOVES IT! Here's What Critics & Pros are Saying About This Series...

Check out More Reviews for the Book: 
"A brutally bloody take on Sci-fi/ fantasy that doesn't hold back... Wailing Blade is the Executioner Sci-Fi Fantasy You Didn’t Know You Needed..." - Geek.com
"Loved it! 5 out of 5 stars..." - TheNewestRant.com
 "A Bloody, Brutal Blend Of Fantasy & Sci-Fi..." - Comicon.com
"Wailing Blade has a swagger to it... a lot of fun and a strong start." - Omnicomic.com
"Wailing Blade is the kind of comic that Image was built on in the late 90's. " - GWW.com 
"Wailing Blade is Terminator with a touch of fantasy, Rich Douek and Joe Mulvey bring it all in this fantastic debut... engrossing and full of action..." - Thecomiclounge.com 
AND MOST IMPORTANTLY, HERE'S HOW COMIC FANS AND RETAILERS HAVE REACTED TO WAILING BLADE:
We create for the fans, and the fans help us create, which is why we're here!  
Feast Your Eyes on These Pages Inside the Book...
Wailing Blade features breathtaking fantasy vistas... a vivid, dangerous dark future world you've never scene before, as depicted in this scene from WAILING BLADE #1:
Some of the most brutal, bloody fight sequences ever committed to the comic book page, as in this scene here from WAILING BLADE #2:
And one of the biggest, action-set showdowns between TWO fearsome executioners, the unstoppable HEADTAKER vs. the merciless BONEBREAKER, shown here in WAILING BLADE #4: 
Want to See Even More Before You Take the Blade?
We are SO CONFIDENT in our book and believe that if you TAKE THE BLADE you won't want to let go, which is why we're making the entire, extra-sized issue WAILING BLADE #1 available for you absolutely free! 
If you'd like to read even more of Wailing Blade before you back this campaign, we invite you to download THE ENTIRE Oversized FIRST ISSUE absolutely FREE!
⚔️ CLICK HERE TO GET WAILING BLADE #1 FOR FREE ⚔️  
 Who are the Creators Behind the Screaming Blood-soaked Thrill Ride That is Wailing Blade? 
Wailing Blade is an action-packed, dystopian future fever dream created by Rich Douek (Road of Bones, Sea of Sorrows) and Joe Mulvey (SCAM).
Rich Douek
Rich is an award-winning copywriter, and the creator of the independent comic series, Gutter Magic. He has worked on the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Universe comics for IDW, and has published short stories in the New York Times-featured All We Ever Wanted anthology, for A Wave Blue World, as well as anthologies for Comixtribe and Red Stylo press. Additonally, he is a moderator of the Comics Experience Creator's Workshop, where he strives to help newer creators learn how to create their own comics and navigate the industry.
Joe Mulvey
Joe made his comics debut as the writer and illustrator of the electrifying super-powered Vegas heist series Scam, from ComixTribe. He is also the writer, artist and creator of the acclaimed children's book Mummy's Always Right, and was published in the Where We Live Anthology from Image Comics. His next series, Happy Hill, will be published by ComixTribe soon! 
Christopher Sotomayor
Chris has been a mainstay at Marvel and DC Comics since 1996 working on titles like Captain America, Black Panther, Captain Marvel, Nightwing, Detective Comics, SuperGirl and pretty much everything else at one point or another.  In addition to working for every major comic publisher in the business, Chris also teaches a course on digital coloring for comics at http://www.comicsexperience.com.  Stay in school. Don't do drugs.
Taylor Esposito
Taylor is a comic book lettering professional and owner of Ghost Glyph Studios. As a staff letterer at DC, he lettered titles such as Red Hood and The Outlaws, Constantine, Bodies, CMYK, and New Suicide Squad. Prior to this, Taylor was credited on numerous titles for Marvel as a production artist. He is currently working on a new batch of creator-owned titles, such as Interceptor: Reactor and Friendo (Vault Comics), Exorsisters and Jook Joint (Image), and Babyteeth (Aftershock). Other publishers he has worked with include Line Webtoon (Acursian, Finality) Dynamite (Battlestar Galactica, Rainbow Brite, Army of Darkness/Bubba Ho-Tep), and IDW (Scarlett’s Strike Force).
Rich writes:
For me, growing up, my favorite books were the ones that transported me to different lands. Wild adventures I could get lost in as I followed the heroes along on their journey. Middle Earth, Hyboria, The Young Kingdoms, The Dying Earth. To me, it's not escapism to want to dwell in worlds like that for a little while. The wonderful thing about fiction, especially genre fiction is that it gives you a taste of the impossible - a window into another world. And that feeling, that exhilarating feeling of cracking open a book and getting lost in it, even for a moment, is something that I've always wanted to create for someone else. And I believe that Wailing Blade is a book that will.
It's often said that you should make the comics that you want to see in the world. In that respect, Wailing Blade is everything we've ever wanted to see in a comic. It's got action, it's got adventure. Compelling characters, and a lush, vibrant world for them to inhabit. We couldn't be happier to share it with you.
What Exactly Is This Kickstarter For?
The team has already invested tens of thousands of dollars and thousands of man-hours into the development of this first WAILING BLADE series.
The WAILING BLADE COLLECTION issue is 100% complete and ready to print.
With your support here on Kickstarter, we can truly create the most incredible foil-enhanced, die-cut hardcover edition possible, while also offering some more affordable softcover and digital editions so all fans of hard-hitting dark sci-fi comics can TAKE THE BLADE! 
CHECK OUT THESE INCREDIBLE REWARDS!
ADD-ONS
 Want to customize your pledge and add a few more goodies?

Project Budget
Your support on Kickstarter will help us cover the large cost of printing and shipping thousands of books around the globe.
WAILING BLADE PROJECT TIMELINE
The Kickstarter Campaign: Oct 20 - Nov 20
Kickstarter Funds Received: Dec 4
Wailing Blade Vol 1 to Print: Early December
Merchandise in Production: December 
Book Manufacturing and Freight: (December/January)
Extra Buffer Time for Unexpected Issues: (Late January)
Expected Deliver to US Backers: (Mid February)
Expected Deliver for INT Backers: (March)
BACK WITH CONFIDENCE, BECAUSE COMIXTRIBE ALWAYS DELIVERS! 
We've built our comics business by always delivering for thousands of backers like you. 
This launch will be no different, as we look forward to serving long-time fans and first-time readers alike!
THIS BLADE IS SHARP, SO HERE'S HOW WE'LL PROTECT IT IN TRANSIT!
As Kickstarter fans and collector's ourselves, we know there's nothing worse than backing a comic project and then having your rewards arrive damaged.
After consulting with our backers, we've revamped our shipping practices to ensure your comics and collectibles arrive in great condition.
All books shipped will be secured in Gemini Comic Supply Comic Flash Mailers, which provides impact-resistant protection.
Orders with multiple comics will be sandwich packed and secured for additional protection.
And our Wailing Boxes will be BUBBLE WRAPPED before being inserted into a second shipping box, so that it arrives in great condition.
Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our project. We would be absolutely thrilled if you're ready to take the next step and join this campaign!
Will YOU Be the Next to Take the Blade?
If you've made it this far, you may be ready to be the very next person to TAKE THE BLADE!
If so, we'd like to ask you to scroll back up this page, choose an awesome reward, and pledge to be a part of this campaign today.
On behalf of the entire Wailing Blade team, thank you so much for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The support of backers on Kickstarter has been instrumental to the success of ComixTribe since our very first project back in 2012.

Our success would not have been possible without the support of thousands of backers like you over the years, many who have come back launch after launch to support us...

So you better believe we take the trust of our backers very seriously.

We've taken a number of actions to mitigate risk associated with this campaign, including completing the creation of the book prior to launching and establishing a strong relationship with a quality printer who has done great work for us in the past and known for a hands on attention to detail and quality craftsmanship.

Every Kickstarter campaign comes with risks, unforeseen hiccups, and lessons learned...and we've certainly learned valuable lessons from every past campaign.

During this time of global uncertainty, we realize that steady communication with our backers throughout the campaign and fulfillment process is key... and should any unforeseen issues cause delays, our backers will be the first to know.

campaign.story:
After surviving a horrific attack by a serial killer that sews the eyelids of victims shut, Tinsley Marissa Grace is looking for answers...
But the detectives on the case seem to be as lost about what's going on as she is, having hunted the killer before and never actually catching the perp. Now, there seems to a cult dedicated to following the killer's methods and believing that the killer is some kind of messiah meant to free them and bring judgment to others. 

What's the story?
DON'T EVER BLINK Chapter 2 is the second issue of a 5-issue limited horror comic book series about a woman who survives a harrowing and horrific ordeal, the massacre of her fiance and his family, but not without her being scarred for life in more than one way; Tinsley Marissa Grace is found alive but her eyelids have been sewn shut -- a calling card of a killer that has eluded authorities before and now has returned. 
The Second Chapter is about Tinsley looking for answers and the lengths that she will go to find them. However, the small town of Billesbrooke, VA is less than giving, and the detectives on the case may no more than their letting on as the killer's cult becomes more of a problem. 
Who will like this?
Horror comic book fans.
Horror/Slasher/Psychological thriller movie fans.
B-movie enthusiasts.
Before you back DON'T EVER BLINK Chapter 2, check out some of the rewards that we have to offer. We offer shipping to anywhere in the world, but shipping costs are separate from the reward costs. 
Look at the mounting evidence - An excerpt from DON'T EVER BLINK Chapter 2:
We are hoping that you all will continue this journey with us on this horrifically mysterious psychological ride, the second chapter of a 5-issue series that promises to delve into the machinations of both monsters and men (mankind) as the truth unravels and questions about the killer, Tinsley, the detectives, and the small town are answered.

campaign.story:
STRETCH GOAL: 25k!
STRETCH GOAL $20k -- UNLOCKED!

STORY
A stolen car and a botched robbery pushes one man to the precipice, where he must choose between the life of his closest friend, and that of a complete stranger. 

MURDER BOOK
“Murder book” refers to a detective's case file on a homicide investigation. Murder books typically include crime scene photographs and sketches, autopsy and forensic reports, transcripts of investigator’s notes and witness interviews. They chronicle the life of a case, from the time the murder is reported until an arrest is made.
CATCH & RELEASE: A MURDER BOOK STORY is an original graphic novel about crime and consequence. It’s written by me, Ed Brisson (Old Man Logan, Uncanny X-Men), and lusciously illustrated by Lisandro Estherren (Redneck, Strange Skies of East Berlin). This stand-alone graphic novel will be published in an exclusive hardcover edition for Kickstarter backers.
Cover by Lisandro Estherren
After nearly half a decade away from writing crime comics -- a genre I love more than any other -- I’m making a return with the Kickstarter Exclusive Hardcover edition of CATCH & RELEASE: A MURDER BOOK STORY. This book is near and dear to my heart, and probably the most pure distillation of the kind of book that I want to write.

CATCH & RELEASE: A MURDER BOOK STORY is about a thief who concocts a plan to sell a stolen car not once, but several times, by luring unsuspecting buyers to a remote location and robbing them at gunpoint. His plan hits a snag when he encounters a student, who needs a fresh set of wheels to travel to his new life out West. When things go south, they go south hard, and now our car thief stands on a precipice where he has to make a choice that will affect not only his life, but that of his co-conspirator and their two victims. The story is an examination of one man’s guilt and how far he’s willing to go to stay out of jail. 
Art by Lisandro Estherren
When I started writing the script -- the longest MURDER BOOK story to date -- I knew that there was only one artist who could do it justice: Lisandro Estherren. He and I had previously worked together on THE LAST CONTRACT for BOOM! Studios and have been looking for an excuse to team up once again. Thankfully, he was into the story and happy to come aboard to breathe life into this story about a deception and redemption.
Art by Lisandro Estherren

THE TEAM
Ed Brisson has been creating comics in one form or another since 1994. He’s best known for his work at Marvel on books such as UNCANNY X-MEN, IRON FIST, GHOST RIDER, OLD MAN LOGAN and X-FORCE. He also has a long history of writing creator-owned books such as COMEBACK (Image), SHELTERED (Image), THE LAST CONTRACT (BOOM!) and THE VIOLENT (Image).

Ed first started to gain recognition from his self-published series MURDER BOOK, which was collected and released by Dark Horse in 2015.
Lisandro Estherren is a comic artist based in Argentina. His work includes graphic novels, series, and illustration for publishers and magazines such as Editorial Pictus (Argentina), Aurea Editoriale (Italy) Diábolo (Spain) and Mojito (Uruguay). In the US, he has produced series for Red5 Comics (Spook) and BOOM! Studios (The Last Contract). He is currently working on REDNECK for Skybound Comics.
Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou makes Strip Panel Naked, a YouTube series focusing on breaking down comic art. He also does this a lot on his twitter (@HassanOE). He might make films that you'd like.
Linney Incorporated is run by editor/writer/producer Nate Cosby, who's worked on Cow Boy, Thor The Mighty Avenger, Red Sonja, Jim Henson's The Storyteller, World War Hulk, Spider-Man Loves Mary Jane, James Bond, The Wonderful World Of Oz, Flash Gordon and sooooooooo many more books.

WHY KICKSTARTER
I’ve been a fan of the Kickstarter publishing method for years now and have always wanted to bring a project here, where we can cut out the middleman and create a book for readers, backed by readers.

Kickstarter allows Lisandro and I to maintain complete control over the story and production of the book, creating a work that is as purely a product of our love for the genre and medium.

The money raised through this campaign will be used to pay the creative team and for printing of the hardcover book.

WHAT YOU CAN GET
We are delighted to print this stand alone story in a Kickstarter exclusive deluxe hardcover, as well as a digital edition of the book. CATCH & RELEASE: A MURDER BOOK STORY is a 72 page book, printed at standard comic size (6.625 x 10.25 inches).

Aside from the book itself, we have plenty of fun rewards including commissions from Declan Shalvey and Micheal Walsh; script reviews from Matthew Rosenberg and Kelly Thompson; original artwork; and even a chance to appear in the book yourself!

A NOTE ON SHIPPING
Because of how quickly shipping rates can change and the unexpected nature of the world, shipping costs will be added on later, when we ship the book out to you in 2021. You will get a survey from BackerKit where you will be asked for your address, and shipping costs will be calculated at that point. We will do the best we can to make shipping as affordable as possible. Our current shipping estimates are as follows (but these may change if shipping rates increase): $4 US  / $10 Canada / $25 EU, GB and elsewhere. 
Canadian orders will ship from Canada, all other orders will ship from the US.
THANK YOU!
Thank you to our families and readers for getting us this far!

campaign.story:
A rough and tumble thumbnail sketch book for the cartoonist or designer on the go. 
 Hi! My name is Jeff McComsey! I am a cartoonist, writer and educator making comics for the past 13 years. 
You fine backers have always helped me print a mess of these Thumb Books for a lot of cartoonists, designers, students... and, well I ran out of them... again.  
With your help I hope to finance a new run of Thumb Books and share them with OG backers and new backers alike.

WHERE IT ALL STARTED:
Like most cartoonists and comic artists, I did my thumbnails on loose paper and I would inevitably lose them in the sea of paper in my studio. My initial solution was an improvised thumbnail template stapled together. I’ve been refining Thumb Book over the years and this will be the fourth official printing.
SPECS:
The THUMB BOOK is 4”x 5.5”and is currently 60 pages.
-Designed to be a pocket sized sketch book with a template on each page that corresponds to the layout of a standard comic page, but one that is adaptable to other formats as well.
 Originally created to help me keep all my preliminary work in one spot, I also like them because I can grab a script, pencil, Thumb Book and hit a coffee shop if I need a change of scenery.
HOW I USE THEM:
 Some of my finished pages I ink and pencil digitally, but I always start with a pencil and Thumb Book.
 BREAKDOWNS 
Once I have a script in hand I do small breakdowns four up on the Thumb Book page. Here I'm mostly focusing on leaving enough room for lettering and making sure speaking order is reflected in layout.
THUMBNAILS
 After that each breakdown gets taken to a full (Thumb Book) page layout. I try and make those thumbnails as tight as possible. I then scan those thumbnails and enlarge them to begin the penciling stage.
SCANS
Once I scan in my thumbs and make a spread out of them, I'll share them with editorial or any other creative partners on the project. This also let's me look at stories as a whole and see if I'm repeating a layout too much.

WHO ELSE USES THESE?
The Thumb Book is pocket size and perfect for anyone that needs a handy sketch book for that crucial design stage where you brainstorm with a pencil. 
-3D piece concepts
-Storyboards (there's board/ratio conversion specs in the back of the Thumb Book)
-Landscaping concepts
-Good for comic writers to help visualize pages while scripting.


 REWARDS:
I've added some of my original art and signed books to help make this a successful campaign.
 **NOTE: Backers will select their book via the survey section after funding.
 FRIENDS OF THE CAMPAIGN!

CLICK HERE TO CHECK IT OUT!
Wailing Blade is high-adrenaline fantasy adventure, set in the dark future of mankind. When his father is sentenced to death at the hands of the legendary Headtaker, bandit prince Tychon must find a way to save him, or fall to the Wailing Blade himself.
Basically, if you took a blender and mixed up Masters of the Universe with Mad Max, tossed in a little Conan and lots of Heavy Metal, that’s what’s in store for you in the pages of WAILING BLADE.
